loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for specialized training to set up a business.

loans.name: Kpedenou -Ekpui-Tsive-Vogan Group

texts.fr: Âgée de 67 ans, Madame Tonoussi est agricultrice. Elle est responsable du groupe KPEDENOU – Ekpui – Tsivé- VOGAN. Cette femme mariée a deux enfants de 28 et 19 ans, dont un est toujours dans la vie étudiante. Elle entame son deuxième cycle dans notre institution de micro finance(WAGES).  Elle est à la tête d’une entreprise de quatre employés. Et ce crédit lui permettra d’augmenter sa surface cultivable, mais également d’investir dans son activité de petit commerce.  Ainsi madame Tonoussi  pourra elle aussi assurer la santé et le bien être de sa famille. Elle assurera de plus la formation de son dernier enfant. Ce crédit permettra en outre le développement de toute l’agriculture locale. Les 13 autres personnes étant dans des situations similaires à celle de madame Tonoussi  et exerçant la même profession.
texts.en:
Ms. Tonoussi, aged 67, is a farmer. She is the official of the group KPEDENOU – Ekpui – Tsivé- VOGAN. She is a married woman and has two children, 28 and 19 years old, of whom one is still a student. Ms. Tonoussi is starting her second [loan] cycle with our microfinance institution (WAGES). 

She is the head of an enterprise of four employees. And this loan will enable her to increase her arable land but also invest in her small-scale business.  Thus, she will also be able to ensure the health and well-being of her family, as well as her youngest child's training. This loan will furthermore enable her to develop the local agriculture entirely. The thirteen other persons, being in the same situation as Ms. Tonoussi's, work in the same profession.

loans.use: to purchase work tools

loans.name: Turemeshanye Group

texts.fr:
Odette  fait partie du groupe Turemeshanye et habite à  Bujumbura. Elle  a 39 ans et est mariée à  Joseph, un garnisseur. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants  âgés de 12 à 19 ans, tous étudient.
  
Elle fait le commerce de riz depuis 8 ans. 

Elle est à son sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de riz à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait  devenir une commerçante  grossiste.
texts.en:
Odette is part of the group Turemeshanye and lives in Bujumbura. She is 39 years old and married to Joseph, an upholstery. Together they have two children, aged 12 and 19 years old, both in school.

Odette has been doing commerce in rice for eight years. 

She is on her sixth Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of rice to resell in order to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to become a wholesale merchant.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of rice to resell in order to earn more

loans.name: Winrose

texts.en:
Winrose is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 7 years to 18 years. She operates a retail shop where she sells cooking oil, salt, sugar etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are commercial and local customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be robbery. 

She will use the Kes 6,900 loan to buy a solar lamp. Her business goal is to expand her business and serve customers to their satisfaction within five years. She also has a farm where she grows maize, beans and groundnuts to sell to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Ek Phnom district where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Mao, 38, is a married mother of two children. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming on a three-hectare area of farmland and planting soybeans. To earn more income, they have been catching fish. She and her husband have been in these businesses for 18 years.

Mao is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Mao will use her portion to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Chhneang's Group

texts.en:
Chhneang is aged 43 years old and married. She lives with her husband and six children in a rural area of Sangke district of Battambang province. She and her husband are rice farmers and they supplement their income by catching fish. Having been in this business for 11 years, together they can earn about KHR 6,000 per day. 

Chhneang has been with VisionFund for three cycles, and she completely paid back the prior loans, which have helped her improve her family’s living conditions. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on materials for supporting her fishing business. She hopes to grow her business and plant more crops to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 38-year-old, married woman. She has one child who is 13 years old. She describes herself as God-fearing. 

Judith operates a pharmacy where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are commercial and local customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be robbery and low capital. 

She will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a gas cooker. Her business goal is to open several branches within five years.

loans.use: buy a gas cooker.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is from Poblacion, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. There, she runs her retail store, selling motor spare parts and accessories. She has been doing this for many years to make a living. She is 54 years old, married, and the mother of two children.

In 2010, she joined GDMPC, and recently she borrowed a loan. She used it to purchase additional motorcycle parts, accessories, and oil. She plans to improve her business, by starting to provide motorcycle repair services at her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional motorcycle parts, accessories, and oil

loans.name: Chy's Group

texts.en:
Chy is living in a rural village of the Sangke district, in Battambang province. Chy is a 46-year-old mother of seven children. She and her husband have been earning a living by catching fish to sell, for ten years. In this business, they earn about 50,000 KHR per day.

Chy’s Group is comprised of two members who live in the same village. Chy is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Chy wants to use her portion of the loan funds to buy materials to use in her fishing business. She hopes to catch more fish and sell them on time, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy materials to use in her fishing business

loans.name: Mujeres De Exito De Rocafuerte  (Rocafuerte) Group

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días los socios del Banco Comunal Mujeres De Éxito de Rocafuerte. Este grupo está integrado por 10 mujeres  y 2 hombres, este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país. Ellos unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, con el cual esperan aumentar sus negocios para el bienestar de sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es  la señora Carmen Dolores, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos niñas,  una de 4 años y la menor de 2 meses de nacida, vive con los padres. Ella es Ing. en Contabilidad y Auditoría.

Doña Carmen Dolores para salir adelante junto a sus pequeñas hijas se dedica al comercio, vende productos por catálogos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella también realiza trabajos contables para ciertos  lugares y personas que requieren de sus servicios, con esto ella se gana algo por su trabajo que junto a sus ganancias de su negocio le sirven para sacar adelante a sus pequeñas. Trabaja casi todos los días ya en sus labores contables o realizando sus recorridos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad  la cual le permite salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ciertos materiales de oficina para sus trabajos contables. Lleva 4 años en el Banco Comunal,  es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta por la ayuda que les brindan con los créditos. 

Su sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The members of the Mujers De Éxito de Rocafuerte communal bank meet every 15 days in the Rocafuerte canton.  This group is comprised of ten women and two men.  This place is known for its delicious sweets that the villagers prepare and are known throughout the country.  The members combine their efforts in order to be able to access the benefits that the Fundación Espoir provides.  With these benefits they hope to expand their businesses for the well-being of their families.

Carmen Dolores, age 32, is one of the members of this group.  She is a single mother with two children, ages four and two months.  She lives with her parents.  She is an auditor and accountant.

In order to get ahead, together with her two young daughters, Carmen Dolores sells Avon and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories) products.  She also does accounting jobs for certain places and people who require her services.  With this she earns something for her work, which together with her income from her business, serves her to get her little ones ahead.

She works almost every day with her accounting work or making her rounds of sales.  She leaves her products on credit, and she collects each week.  She has been engaged in this business activity for over ten years, and it allows her to get ahead.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and some office supplies for her accounting jobs.  She has been in the communal bank for four years, and she is the president.  She likes it for the help that is provided with the loans.  Her dream is to give her daughters the best.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and office supplies.

loans.name: Rafaqat

texts.en:
Rafaqat is a 38-year-old married woman; she has been doing a business of milk sales for the past 14 years to support her family. She has one calf and two cows in milk; she sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and yogurt that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. 

Rafaqat has two daughters and one son; all are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet their day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her ninth year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business through this support.

 Now she has requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for its calf. She hopes to increase the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calf.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani, a 40-year-old married woman, has been in the business of making jewellery boxes for 12 years with her husband. She initially made boxes for her friends and relatives, but then became well-known in her community for her tremendous skill and now caters to a large number of customers. She earns enough to provide for her family.

In order to expand her business, Rani contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase hard boards, cardboard and foams in large quantities to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her net income and wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to purchase hard boards, cardboard and foams in large quantities.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan tiene 46 años, está casado con la Sra. Miguela de 36 años, ellos tienen la dicha de tener  dos hijos, por quienes ambos están esforzándose y luchando, ya que quieren darles todo lo que necesitan y que tengan una vida sin privaciones.
Don Juan comenzó con este rubro hace 13 años, aproximadamente desde el año: 2.000, Él estaba trabajando como empleado en una empresa de exportador de maderas, con el ingreso que ganaba el compraba de a poco las gallinas ponedoras de huevo, y  luego de haber juntado para su capital operativo, decidió dedicarse netamente a su mini empresa, en la actualidad el provee huevos y gallinas en la zona donde vive, y otras zonas aledañas, ya tiene su clientela formada, lo cual hace que su ingreso sea estable y continuo.
Este crédito le servirá para comprar más gallinas ponedoras e insumos (afrechos, maíz, y algunos medicamentos para la sanidad de los animales)
texts.en:
Juan is 46 years old and is married to Miguela who is 36. They are fortunate to have two children and they both work hard and strive to give them everything they need so they do not lack anything in life. 

Juan began in this line of business approximately 13 years ago in the year 2000. He used to work as an employee in a timber export company and with the money he earned he gradually began to buy egg laying hens. Once he had built up his working capital he decided to devote himself entirely to his mini business. Now he supplies eggs and chickens in the area where he lives and other neighbouring areas. He now has a regular clientele, which gives him a continuous steady income. 

This loan will help him to buy more laying hens and supplies (bran, corn and some animal health medicines).

loans.use: to buy laying hens and supplies such as bran, corn and medicines

loans.name: Lelengwe Group

texts.fr: Agriculteur de profession en RÉGION CENTRALE à Sokodé, Mr Essohanam né en 1969  vit avec sa femme revendeuse et leurs 07 enfants à Sokodé. Vu qu’il a une grande superficie, 08 personnes l’aident dans l’exercice de son activité. Pour rendre son activité commencée en 1990 pérenne, il sollicite de WAGES un quatrième crédit dans notre institution(WAGES) pour acheter des outils de travail. Il voudrait avec le profit supplémentaire faire de l’élevage des volailles. Comme perspectives d’avenir, il souhaiterait agrandir sa superficie cultivable et permettre à sa famille de mieux s’épanouir. Notons qu’il est le responsable d’un groupement d’hommes tous ayant  foi en la terre. Ils cultivent du riz, du mais et espèrent rendre pérenne leur activité avec le profit tiré de la vente
texts.en:
Essohanam, born in 1969, is a professional farmer located in the city of Sokodé, in the Central Region of Togo.  He lives with his wife (a reseller), and their seven children, in that same city.  Since his farmland is quite large, eight people help him with his work.  In order to continue his activity, started in 1990, he is requesting a fourth loan from WAGES to buy some farming tools.

Essohanam would like to use his additional profits to raise poultry.  In the future, he would like to increase the surface area of his farmland and to make it possible for his family to be more prosperous. 

It should be noted that Essohanam is the leader of a group of men who all have faith in their land.  These men grow rice and maize and hope to continue their activities with the profits generated from the sale of their crops.

loans.use: to buy farming tools.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man, a 50-year-old mother of five children, lives with her family in the Reussey Keo district of Phnom Penh. Man rents a commercial space at a market where she operates a fish-selling business, earning a net profit of $4.00 per day. To assist Man to generate more income, her husband, Nob, also manages a general store, selling small fish used as bait by people who own fish-breeding ponds in the immediate vicinity of Chrang Chamreh Pir commune.

Man has requested a loan of 1,500 U.S. dollars to purchase fish and bait to sell, and to buy a motorcycle to support them in their daily operations. In the future, Man wants to make improvements to her house and to the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish and bait to sell.

loans.name: Chengner's Group

texts.en:
Chengner, a 29-year-old married mother of two, lives in a wooden house in the Moungkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. The main sources of her family’s income are farming rice and working for others for a fee. She has been in this business for almost ten years, earning about 27,000KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Chengner’s group with VisionFund. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 49-year-old, married woman. She works hard to provide the basic necessities of life to her eight children. She has been running a small general store, for many years. Her general store is located at the corner of her house, where she offers a variety of grocery items for daily use at reasonable prices. She has become famous by providing good quality products, and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store.

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for Rs 35,000. She will use the loan to purchase packs of salt, sugar, rice, flour, and dozens of eggs. She is in her ninth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation, and she hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase foods to sell at her store, including packs of salt, sugar, rice, flour, and dozens of eggs

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is a Kubo financiero client and this is his story.

My name is Alejandro, I am 46 years old I live with my wife and two sons. I started food snacks but later change to selling tacos, tortas (similar to sandwiches)  and sodas.  I like to sell good quality and clean food at low prices. I will use the loan to buy a refrigerator for my restaurant, that way I all be able to buy sodas from distributors instead of other retailers and increase my profits, also I need the refrigerator to keep the meat and the salsas fresh.

My biggest accomplishments is sending my kids to school and paying my debts on time.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for my restaurant.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.en:
Nacho is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story.

My name is Nacho, I am 42 years old, married with 3 daughters. I have in working in commerce for the last 20 years.I  enjoy retail and always wanted to be my own boss, because of that I decide to open a grocery store. I will use the loan to improve my inventory. In my business I like to provide quality products and good service.  Fortunately it is well located so I have good sales and recurring clients. My biggest accomplishments is sending my daughters to school.

loans.use: To buy groceries, improve inventory and increase sales

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 38-year-old married mother of five children. She has been working in her small restaurant since 2012. Her husband is a retired soldier, and their combined low-income revenues aren't enough to cover their family's needs. 

Nada is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to register her husband's car as a taxi in order to help him work with it legally as a taxi driver, which will provide them with an additional daily income.

Her snacks are well known in the region because of her special toppings, cleanliness, prices, and the customer service she provides. She hopes to expand her snacks to a larger restaurant and a cafe in the future.

loans.use: To register a car as an additional taxi business for her husband

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a Kiva borrower who describes himself as focused and ambitious. He transports customers using a bicycle, to earn an income.

He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy a water tank, to store enough water for use by his family. Five family members will benefit directly from the water tank. He faces a lack of enough water storage capacity, hence the need for a water tank. The challenge he faces in his business is climate change. This is James's first loan with SMEP DTM. He hopes that in future, he will own a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for his family's use

loans.name: Edvert Ken

texts.en:
Edvert Ken is studying for his college education in Misamis Occidental. He is 19 years old, but he is determined to finish a course and to get a job in the future. He does it, not only for his own good, but because he wants to support his parents when they get old. 

He borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in order to finance his school tuition fees and study materials. He hopes to finish his studies and that he can help his family and his community, too.

loans.use: to finance his school tuition fees.

loans.name: Maria Sara

texts.es:
María, se le presenta le necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque con el crédito anterior obtuvo muy buenos resultados; este le permitirá comprar  variedad de mercadería tales como: tomates, cebollas, aceite, azúcar, maíz, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a tener buen efecto, ya que incrementaron las ventas y por ello obtuvo mejores ingresos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: María feels the need to ask for a new loan because she got very good results with the previous loan. This loan will allow her to buy a variety of ingredients such as tomatoes, onions, oil, sugar and corn and other items. The previous loan helped her to make a big improvement, since her sales increased and so she got a better income. Her economic situation and the family's circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, oil, sugar, corn and other items.

loans.name: Sahista

texts.en: Sahista, age 22, is a married woman. She has been stitching clothes for many years, to contribute to the family income.  Her husband works in a factory, with a low income. That is why Sahista is working hard to meet the everyday expenditures of the family members. By this time, she has established a good client list. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to satisfy the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with packs of lace, zippers and needles. This purchase will create a means of increasing revenues, so she may able to generate a healthier income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with packs of lace, zippers and needles.

loans.name: Jessica Marlem

texts.es:
Jessica con 25 años de edad es una joven, agricultora y ama de casa, madre de 2 hijos de los cuales solo uno de ellos estudia en primaria y en su casa de habitación solo vive ella, su compañero de hogar y sus dos hijos. Su ingreso económico es el cultivo de café el cual lo practica en compañía de su pareja hace 5 años siendo su jefe quien le enseñara a trabajar la tierra. El jefe de ellos es su mismo cliente y la tierra que trabajan está ubicada a 25 minutos de distancia al cual se traslada en vehículo el cual es también de su jefe.

Ya que la tierra no es propia pero si los ingresos que salen por cultivar café ella han solicitado a COMIXMUL un financiamiento para poder dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café comprando abono, fertilizantes entre otros el cual ayudara a mantener sus cultivos en óptimas condiciones.

Sus sueños son los de tener sus propias tierra para poder cultivar y trabajar los propio, asegurar el futuro de sus hijos, poder generar ganancias netas para su hogar y crecer con una cosecha propia.
texts.en:
Jessica is 25 years old is a young farmer and housewife. She has two children, one of whom studies at primary school. She lives with her partner and her two children. She has made a living growing coffee with her partner for five years, and her boss showed her how to work the land. Their boss is also their customer and the land they farm is located 25 minutes away, which they get to in their bosses vehicle.

As the land they farm isn't theirs but the income they make from it is, they have requested a loan from COMIXMUL to support and maintain their coffee crops, buying compost, fertilizer, and other products which will help to keep their crops in optimum condition.

Her dreams are to own her own plot of land on which to farm, to ensure the future of her children, to make net earnings for her home, and to grow her own harvest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Luz Miriam

texts.es: Luz Miriam es una señora de 44 años de edad, soltera y madre cabeza de hogar, vive con sus tres hijos de 11,15 y 18 años de edad. Actualmente es comerciante independiente, pues inicialmente comenzó con un puesto de remates y ahora tiene un bar. Trabaja arduamente día a día para obtener dinero y poder sacar a sus hijos adelante. El crédito que solicita es para invertirlo en un curso de capacitación en Servicio de Mesa y Bar, ya que quiere aprender todo lo relacionado con el tema para poder ofrecer un excelente servicio en su nuevo negocio. Su principal sueño es aprender a preparar diversas bebidas y cócteles para ofrecer a sus clientes una variedad de productos que satisfagan los gustos de todos y, así incrementar las ventas y por ende los ingresos, para continuar dando el sustento a sus hijos y darles la oportunidad de tener una excelente educación, para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Miriam is 44 years old, single, and is the head of the household. She lives with her three children aged 11,15 and 18. She currently works as an independent trader, as she originally began with a sale stall and now has a bar. She works hard every day to make money and support her children. 

The loan she is requesting is to invest in a training course in waiting and bar service, because she wants to learn everything about the subject so she can offer excellent service in her new business. Her biggest dream is to learn how to prepare different drinks and cocktails to offer her customers a variety of products, so that there is something for everyone. In this way, she will be able to increase sales and, in turn, earnings, to continue supporting her children and give them the opportunity to have a good education to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for a training course in waiting and bar service.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru: Зухра имеет «золотые руки». Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Зухра более 8 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она опытная портниха и создает шедевры таджикских национальных платьев. Она имеет ателье в центре города. Благодаря  хорошему сервису, она обладает широким кругом клиентов. Она имеет 2 швейных машинок марки «Чайка». Она планирует купить 2 вышивальные машинки, но ее доход не позволяет ей купить это. Она запрашивает займ для покупки вышивальной машинки. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zuhra has "golden hands."  She is married and raising two children.  Zuhra has been involved in providing seamstress services for over 8 years.  She is an experienced seamstress and creates Tajik national dress masterpieces.  She has a salon in the city center.  Thanks to a good service, she has a wide circle of clients.  She has two Chayka sewing machines.  She plans to purchase two embroidery machines, but her income does not allow her to make this purchase.  She relies on you and your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase two embroidery machines

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Kuña Aty es de Ciudad del Este, está integrado por 13 mujeres muy capaces y emprendedoras, que están luchando por mejorar la vida de sus familias. Estan haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y tres de ellas están con ingresos bajos, pero se están esforzando el doble por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra Rosa quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy por debajo. Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes y por medio de ese trabajo es que está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de perfumes y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas y seguir luchando por mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“Kuña Aty” is from Ciudad del Este and has 13 very capable, enterprising members who are striving to improve their families’ lives.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey and three of them are low-income but are trying double hard to improve.

One of the members is Rosa who in the previous survey was in poverty level one, that is to say very low income.  By means of her effort and continuous work and by applying vital behaviors of successful women, she’s now improving her poverty situation.  She works selling perfume and by means of this work is getting ahead and helping her family.

She requests this loan to buy perfume so she can continue with her sales and striving to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy perfume to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Kyrey son mujeres son de Ciudad del Este están en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Cada una se unió para poder ayudar a su familia, y de paso también poder ayudar a su comunidad para ir creciendo.
Francisca es parte del grupo, y también es presidenta del grupo, ella trabaja siempre por incentivar a sus amigas y compañeras a seguir luchando. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de segunda mano, y cuenta que está yendo muy bien, debido a que las prendas de segunda están siendo muy aceptadas. Quiere seguir creciendo y es por eso que quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas de segunda mano para poder venderlas y de esa forma seguir creciendo en su negocio y luchar por su familia.
texts.en:
The group called “Kuña Kyrey” is women from Ciudad del Este and they are in cycle #4 in the women’s committee program; they all work and help each other out in order to get ahead.  Each one of them joined in order to be able to help her family and at the same time be able to help her community to grow.

Francisca is part of the group and also its president.  She always works to encourage her fellow members and friends to continue striving.  She works selling second-hand clothes and says that she’s doing very well because the second-hand clothes are being well-received.   She wants to continue to grow which is why she wants to invest in her business.

She’s requesting this loan to buy second-hand clothes to be able to sell and continue growing this way in her business and to strive for her family.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is a 52-year-old married woman and has been in the business of milk sales for many years. She has two buffaloes to milk. After collecting milk from them she sells it to the people of her town. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She is a mother of seven children and is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life and good education, food and clothing. Jamila has improved her business to meet daily expenses. This is her third year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business through its support. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She hopes to increase milk production which ultimately would help generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Mrika

texts.en:
Mrika has been photographed in front of her animal stable and her little family house; a wall separates people from animals. As she was talking and showing us around, she was sighing in despair. “We remain poor despite the fact that we work hard. I’ve got to raise four school-aged children, but anyhow…” She ended the conversation looking away.

Mrika has been in the livestock business for the past fifteen years, raising and taking care of animals and selling fresh dairy produce to the local market of a mid-sized nearby town. “I can’t say that I haven’t made any money. I have secured food for my family through this activity and this is what I am grateful for the most,” she continued saying.

Mrika wants to build a stable that will be a bit farther from the family home.

loans.use: to build a stable a bit farther from the family home

loans.name: Jennifer Yuliana

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen María se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Ciudad de clima cálido y con una gran variedad en su gastronomía que la hacen única.

En este lugar vive la señora Jennifer, tiene 21  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 3 años de edad el cual requiere de muchos cuidados. Su esposo es albañil.

Doña Jennifer es una joven madre que para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a recorrer la ciudad  en sus ratos libres y fines de semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez  que necesita. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y en ocasiones cuando su esposo se queda sin  trabajo es así como salen adelante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  tres años y le gusta porque con la ayuda del primer crédito empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya vive donde los suegros.
texts.en:
The Virgen Maria communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi region, known for its rich pre-colonial culture, and for its arts known nationally and internationally.  It’s a city with a warm climate and with a great variety of food which makes in unique.

Jennifer lives here.  She is 21 years old, married, and has a three year old son who needs a lot of care.  Her husband is a mason.

Jennifer is a young mother who sells clothing of different types, door to door, in order to help her husband with the household expenses.  She goes out to make her runs in her spare time and on the weekends and sells on credit, collecting every week.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to and has been doing this for three years.  This is how they make ends meet whenever her husband is out of work.

She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts and children’s clothing.  She has been a member of the communal bank for three years and started her business with her first loan.

Her dream is to have home of her own because she currently lives with her in-laws.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Elsy Yolanda

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo cada quince días  se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras de Olmedo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Elsy, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 20 y 19 años que  estudian en la universidad y  aun viven con ellos. Su marido es comerciante.

Doña Elsy tiene junto a su marido tienen una tienda de víveres en un mercado local, allí venden todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes entre otras cosas, además de ciertas bebidas como sodas y aguas, trabajan todos los días desde la madrugada que es cuando muchos clientes del campo visitan su local para abastecerse de productos. Tienen su tienda más de 18  años y  gracias a los  créditos la ido mejorando con el pasar de los días.ç

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes entre otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 6 años y le gusta porque con los  créditos cada día mejora más su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener un local propio ya que en el que  están tienen que pagar arriendo.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras de Olmedo” (Enterprising Women from Olmedo) communal bank meets in Olmedo Canton every fifteen days.  This place is noted for its beautiful scenery and for its hardworking people dedicated to agriculture and animal husbandry.

Elsy, 42, lives here.  She’s married and has two children who are 20 and 19 years of age attending university and still living at home.  Her husband’s a merchant.

Elsy and her husband have a grocery store in the local market where they sell all types of basic staples like rice, sugar, oil and detergent, among others, as well as certain beverages like soft-drinks and water.  They work every day from dawn which is when many customers from the countryside come by their shop to stock up on products.  They’ve had their store for more than 18 years and thanks to the loans have been improving as time has gone by.

She will use this loan to better stock her store; she will buy rice, sugar, oil and detergent among other products.  She’s been in the communal bank for six years and likes it because she improves her business more every day with the loans.  Her dream is to have a site of her own because they rent the one they are in now.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Vicente Bacilia

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras de Olmedo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Bacilia, tiene 62 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijas son separadas de sus esposos y viven en su casa con sus hijos. Su marido es chofer.

Ella realiza el crédito para el negocio que tiene su marido en su casa, allí tienen unas mesas de billar en la cual los fines de semana llegan muchas personas a divertirse sanamente y consumir lo que el venden en este lugar, allí vende jugos gaseosas, gelatinas, y varios bocadillos que ella prepara. Todos los días prepara gelatinas las mismas que venden en su local o que su marido se encarga de salir a vender por la localidad, estas son muy deliciosas y que lo que hacen se vende en el día.

Este crédito es para comprar sodas, gaseosas, gelatinas y otros bocadillos que venden en su local. Lleva más de diez años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho. 

Su sueño es tener buena salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
On Olmedo corner, every fifteen days the Mujeres Emprendedoras de Olmedo Community Bank meets. This place is known for its beautiful scenery and hardworking people dedicated to agriculture and raising livestock.

It is here we meet Bacilia, 62 years old, in a civil union with three grown children.Two of her daughters are separated from their husbands and live in her house with their children. Her husband is a driver (chauffeur). 
 
She seeks a loan for the business that her husband has in their home. There they have some billiard tables where on weekends many people have fun in a healthy way, eating what they sell in their business. She sells juices, soda pop, gelatins, and various snacks that she prepares. Every day she makes the gelatins that she sells at her location or that her husband takes and sells in the area. They are very delicious and they sell what they make each day.

This loan is to buy soda pop, gelatins, and other snacks to sell at their business. She has been in the Communal Bank for more than ten years and she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot.

Her dream is for she and her family to have good health.

loans.use: to buy soda pop, gelatins, and other snacks

loans.name: Phillip

texts.en:
Phillip is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. For the past three years, Phillip has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells spare parts . 

To help expand his business, Phillip has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more spare parts to sell and will help Phillip generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Phillip hopes that in the future he will be able to own another retail shop that sells spare parts. 

Phillip is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Phillip who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase for more spare parts for sell

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru: Санобару 49 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Она с детства мечтала стать учительницей. Ее семья была большой и малообеспеченной и поэтому у нее не была возможности поступить в университет и получить высшее образование. Она вышла замуж и родила детей. После нескольких лет она поступила в университет. В это время у нее уже было двое детей. Она с трудом и с большим усилием окончила университет и сейчас она работает в средней школе своего района учительницей. Она вместе с мужем и 3 детьми живет в доме у родителей мужа. Дети выросли и им нужно отдельный дом. В этом году они купили земельный участок, но не имеют денег для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, кирпич, песок и т.п. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sanobar is 49 years old.  She is married and raising three children.  She had been dreaming of becoming a teacher since childhood.  Her family was big and not financially well-off, and this is why she did not have an opportunity to go to a university and get a higher education.  She got married and had children.  She got accepted to a university several years later.  At that time, she already had two children.  She completed the university studies with difficulty and a lot of effort and now works as a teacher at her district's secondary school.  She lives with her husband and three children with her husband's parents.  The children grew up and need a separate house.  The family purchased a land plot this year, but does not have money to buy construction materials, such as cement, bricks, sand, etc.  Sanobar is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, bricks, sand, etc., to build a house

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 36-year-old married father of one child. He has been working in the transportation business for five years. His wife doesn't work, which makes him the family's only source of income. That's why he works hard to develop his business in order to respond better to his family's needs. 

Ahmad is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua  to pay what is left from his van's purchase price.  He hopes that one day he can open a transportation company and he will have more than one van to be capable of covering the whole Lebanese border.

loans.use: pay off his van

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 26-year-old, single man, who has worked for eight years as a car mechanic. In 2010, he started his own business in order to improve his socioeconomic situation and to start planning for his future developments. His work is going just fine, but he needs patience to gain customers' trust and support. His good reputation is his special advantage among the competition.

Bilal is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, in order to register land on which, one day, he'll build his dream house.

Bilal is just like any one else -- he dreams of making a small, happy family. But, before that, he will make sure that his income is good enough to take this step forward. He will work hard to keep his business updated with newly-released machines and tools required to better serve his clients.

loans.use: to register land on which, one day, he'll build his dream house.

loans.name: Alfredo José

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras de Olmedo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 

En este lugar vive el señor Alfredo, tiene 23 años de edad, está soltero y vive en casa de los padres, lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy divertidas y los créditos de gran ayuda.

Don Alfredo tiene un taller de motocicletas, el cual es muy concurrido ya que es muy bueno en lo que realiza, el además de ofrecer sus servicios como mecánico también vende aceites, llantas y todo tipo de repuestos y accesorios para motos,  trabaja de lunes a sábado y si algún cliente requiere de sus servicios hasta los domingos, lleva más de 3 años con su negocio, antes trabajaba en un taller en otra ciudad en el cual aprendió todo lo que sabe y que ahora le permite salir adelante gracias a su trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar llantas, aceites y otros repuestos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 2  años y le gusta porque los créditos salen rápido y le ayudan mucho. 

Su sueño es aumentar más su taller
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras de Olmedo” (Enterprising Women from Olmedo) communal bank meets in Olmedo Canton every fifteen days.  This place is noted for its beautiful scenery and for its hardworking people dedicated to agriculture and animal husbandry.

Alfredo, 23, lives here.  He’s single living in his parents’ house. He’s been in the communal bank for two years and likes it because his fellow members are a lot of fun and the loans are of great help to him.

Alfredo has a motorcycle repair shop that’s very busy because he’s very good at what he does.  In addition to offering his services as a mechanic he also sells oil, tires and all sorts of spare parts and accessories for motorcycles.  He works Monday to Saturday and if a customer requires it even on Sundays.  He’s been in business more than three years.  He used to work in a shop in another city where he learned everything he knows which now makes it possible for him to get ahead by means of his work.

This loan is to buy tires, oil and other spare parts.  He’s been in the communal bank for two years and likes it because the loans are approved quickly and they help him much.  His dream is to enlarge his shop more.

loans.use: to buy tires, oil and other spare parts.

loans.name: Rina Vanessa

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo cada quince días  se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras de Olmedo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 

En este lugar vive la señora Rina, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 21, 18 y 11 años, la menor estudia en escuela y es la que aun vive con ellos. Su marido es chofer.

Doña Rina para ganar algo propio y con esto poder ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale dos a tres días por semana a recorrer por toda la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos, trabaja todos los días ya que además también vende en su  casa donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella en temporadas que el negocio no es muy bueno también cría chanchos.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 2 ciclos  y le gusta por ya ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras de Olmedo” (Enterprising Women from Olmedo) communal bank meets in Olmedo Canton every fifteen days.  This place is noted for its beautiful scenery and for its hardworking people dedicated to agriculture and animal husbandry.

Rina, 37, lives here.  She’s married and has three children who are 21, 18 and 11 years of age; the youngest attends school and is the one still living with them.  Her husband’s a driver.

To earn a bit on her own and help with household expenses, Rina works selling all types of clothes door to door.  She heads out two or three days a week to cover the entire city offering her products.  She works every day because she also sells from home where her best-known customers come by.  She buys merchandise in Guayaquil as needed.  She’s been in this line of work for three years.  In seasons when her business isn’t too good she also raises pigs.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank for two cycles and likes it because of the help the loans provide.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Phyllis

texts.en:
Phyllis is a 35-year old married woman. She has 2 children with ages 1 year and 6 years. She describes herself to be God-fearing. 

Phyllis operates a retail shop where she sells salt, milk, cooking oil, etc. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are commercial customers within the surrounding. She describes her biggest business challenge to be robberies. 

Phyllis will use this KES 12,900 loan to buy a gas cooker. Her business goal is to expand the business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will increase capacity and open several retail shops.

loans.use: buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi operates a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other retail operators.

With this loan she is requesting, Mishi wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business she is grateful and thankful for the opportunity.

loans.use: buy sugar, rice and flour to sell

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua operates a milk selling business, selling to her fellow villagers and also friends. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other milk sale operators.

With this loan she is requesting Mwanamvua wants to purchase 4 milk containers and also add more milk for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy milk and 4 milk containers

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family thanks to her hard work. She wants to invest in a firewood business and also establish a coconut-selling business to generate more income.

Saumu is asking for a loan to buy firewood and coconuts for resale that will help her to invest back into her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy firewood and coconuts for resale

loans.name: Sokvorn's Group

texts.en:
Sokvorn is 34 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Dambae district, Cambodia. All of her four children are still in school. 

To feed the family, Sokvorn and her husband earn a living as farmers who have been growing rubbers and cassavas for ten years. Her husband also earns extra income by working for others for a fee.  Sokvorn can earn about 25,000KHR per day to spend for her family’s needs. 

This is Sokvorn’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  Her group has only two members, who are just with VisionFund this cycle. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. Sokvorn is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her family’s business.  She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of selling bangles for many years. She purchases dozens of colorful bangles from a wholesale market then sells them to the main city at reasonable prices. She is very enthusiastic in her business and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. 

Kousar is a loving mother of three daughters and is responsible for their food, health and education. She applied for a loan of RS 40,000 to purchase dozens of bangles in different colors and sizes for the upcoming event of Eid-ul-Fitar (a religious event for muslims). 

Kousar is in her third loan cycle with a good loan history. She expects a boost in her earnings and is very much thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: buy bangles to resell

loans.name: Dany

texts.en:
Dany, 48, is married and has six children. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Pursat province in Kror Kor district.  The main source of her family’s income is from selling grocery items. Her husband supplements their income by working as a paid worker. 

Dany and her husband have been running her business for 5 years, earning about KHR 16,000 per day and she is able to save about KHR 9000 each day. 

Dany received her third loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, two cycles ago and has effectively used it to sustain her family’s business and support her family’s needs. Now she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 KHR to open a carpenter business. She hopes to earn more income from her business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: open a carpenter business

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: Sharifa is 50-year-old vigorous lady.  She has been sewing clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of RS 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.  This will help her to create more clothes as a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income.  Sharifa is in her 4th loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 28-year-old married woman.  She has been running a business of animals sales for many years with the support of her husband. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. 

Shagufta has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation.  She requested a loan of RS 30,000 to purchase two more goats.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: purchase two goats

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She has been running a business of cloths sales for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. 

Shameem requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season by taking in account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: buy fabrics to resell

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: At the age of 31, Safia does hand embroidery for boutiques. She knows the art of boutique style embroidery and has offered her services for many years. Her immense experience with embroidery has provided her with great versatility to meet her clients' needs. In order to expand her business she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy more spools of threads in various colors, and frames and needles to complete the orders of her customers on time. This is her fourth year with Kashf foundation. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will continue moving in a positive direction as a result of this loan.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in various colors and frames and needles.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last four years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband also assists her by purchasing grocery stock from the wholesale market. Parveen is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy grocery items such as grains, pulses with packs of oil and rice. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is on her third loan and has shown an excellent repayment history. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as grains, pulses with packs of oil and rice.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 44-year-old, married woman and a mother of five. She is a hard-working mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past 27 years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough money to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue the operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000/- to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to stitch up more dresses. In addition to repaying the loan, Bashiran will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.  She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors, with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Holida

texts.ru: Холиде 30 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Холида с ранних лет мечтала стать парикмахером и открыть свой салон красоты. После окончания средней школы она научилась у парикмахера все тонкости мастерства. Холида взяла в аренду помещение и начала свой бизнес. Вначале ей было очень трудно, но благодаря упорному труду она преодолела все трудности. Холида более 8 лет занимается этим бизнесом. Она хочет развевать бизнес дальше. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3100 сомони для покупки оборудования для салона красоты, и оплатить за аренду помещения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Holida is 30 years old.  She is not married and lives with her parents.  Holida had been dreaming of becoming a hairstylist and opening her own beauty salon since a young age.  She learned all of the nuances of the trade from a hairstylist after finishing a secondary school.  Holida leased a space and started her business.  It was difficult at first, but thanks to her hard work, she overcame all of the difficulties.  Holida has been involved in this business for over 8 years.  She wants to develop her business further.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3100 somoni to purchase equipment for the beauty salon and to pay for the space lease.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for the beauty salon and to pay for the space lease

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Gerardo es un cliente nuevo de la Fundación vive en la ciudad de Encarnación, está acompañado, y cuenta que tiene dos hijos, quienes lo inspiran para luchar y salir adelante.
Gerardo es dueño de una despensa bien surtida en el centro de encarnación ya hace mas de 4 años en donde trabaja su esposa atendiendo en el negocio, Él es funcionario de la municipalidad por la mañana, y por la tarde también está en su despensa.
Gerardo solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos de primera necesidad para poder surtir su negocio, como ser verduras, frutas, carne, bebidas y demás para seguir luchando por cumplir su meta.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a new Fundación client.   He lives in the city of Encarnación, has a spouse and says he has two children that inspire him to strive and continue forward.  

Gerardo has owned a well-stocked grocery store in downtown Encarnación for more than four years now where his wife works managing the business.  He’s a city employee mornings and is in his grocery store afternoons.

Gerardo is asking for this loan to buy basic staples like vegetables, fruit, meat, beverages, etc. to stock his store and continue striving to reach his goal.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Divinas está en el 1º ciclo  del programa de comité, están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y están luchando, ellas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. La mayoría de las integrantes realizan actividades productivas y las que no tienen proyecto de emprender para poder así ir aumentando sus ingresos.
Una de las integrantes la Sra. Yolanda se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras y también a la elaboración de comidas, y el crédito lo utiliza para la compra de insumos como ser frutas y verduras.
Ella se define a sí misma como una persona muy emprendedora que lucha y quiere salir adelante para ayudar a su familia en todo lo que puede.
texts.en:
The “Las Divinas” (The Divine Ones) group is in the committee program’s first cycle.  They are learning to work together and are striving.  They all work and help each other out to get ahead.  Most of the members carry out productive activities and the ones that don’t have projects planned in order to increase their income.

One of the members is Yolanda who sells fruit and vegetables and also prepared meals.  She will use the loan to buy ingredients like fruit and vegetables.  She defines herself as a very enterprising woman who strives and wants to get ahead to help her family in every way possible.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and food making ingredients.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
Las 13 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas se esfuerzan por ir mejorando su vida y la de su familia. Todas son mujeres jefas de familia que han visto una gran oportunidad por medio de la fundación y su programa de comité de mujeres.
Marina es la presidenta de este grupo, ella es una persona con gran espíritu de superación, y siempre lucha por mostrar un ejemplo a sus compañeras y luchar por lo que quieren. Ella compra y vende carne, y es por medio de ese trabajo que tiene los medios e ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, para la reventa,  y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The 13 members of this committee pursue a range of activities. Each one of them makes an effort to continue improving her life and that of her family. All of them are female heads of household who have seen a great opportunity in the Foundation and its women's committee program. 

Marina is the president of this group. She is a person with a great inspiration to improve her life, and she always works hard to offer an example to her fellow members, to work hard for what they want. She buys and sells meat, and through this work she has the means and the income to help her family. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in buying meat to resell. In this way she will continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 38-year-old, married woman. She has been operating a small general store for the last seven years and, with the income earned, she has been able to restock her business. She offers a variety of grocery items for daily use, at a reasonable price, and she has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough money to provide for her family. 

To fully-stock her store, she requested a loan for PKR 25,000 which she will use to buy from the market at lower rates, sugar and salt, with some packs of biscuits and beverages. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt, with some packs of biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of four children from San Miguel, Bohol. Annabelle is a farmer, and has been in the farming business for more than four years. She works with her husband in tilling the land.

Annabelle is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve their farm as well as their harvest. 

In the future, Annabelle hopes to make their farming business a success, and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Kabogozi Group

texts.fr:
Normand fait partie du groupe  Kabogozi et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a  56 ans et est marié  à  Ana, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants, dont 4 étudient.
  
Il fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, riz,…) depuis   5 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de haricot  à revendre  pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, il   voudrait voir ses enfants diplômés.
texts.en:
Normand is a member of the Kabogozi group and he lives in Rumonge.  He is 56 years old and married to a farmer named Ana.  Normand and Ana have five children, four of whom are in school.

Normand has been selling food products such as beans and rice for five years.

This is his first loan with Turame.  With this loan, which he is receiving from KIVA, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of beans for resale in order to increase his earnings.

In the coming years, he would like to see his children graduate from school.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beans for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Andrés

texts.es: Carlos Andrés es un hombre de 26 años de edad, soltero y aún no tiene hijos. Actualmente se dedica a atender su negocio, una barbería que tiene hace 3 años. Conoció la labor hace varios años, cuando trabajaba en otra barbería como auxiliar y allí aprendió gran parte de lo que hoy sabe; en el momento le brinda la oportunidad de empleo a 3 personas más; adicionalmente vende mercancía como ropa, gafas, gorras, gel para el cabello, con lo cual ha logrado obtener los ingresos para su sostenimiento. Es una persona trabajadora,  es emprendedor y organizado. Es el cuarto crédito que solicita con la Corporación y lo desea invertir en la compra de un nuevo lava cabezas, 3 máquinas para cortes y surtido  de mercancía (camisetas, gafas, gel capilar) con el fin de seguir prestando un excelente servicio con buenas herramientas de trabajo y ofreciendo variedad de productos para incrementar sus ventas. Su principal sueño es poder continuar con su negocio y comprarse su propio apartamento, para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos Andrés is a 26-year-old single man; he has no children yet.  He currently works managing his business, a barber shop he’s had for three years.  He learned this occupation several years ago when he worked as a helper in a barber shop; he learned much of what he knows today there.  He’s currently able to provide employment opportunities for three additional people.  In addition, he sells merchandise like clothes, sunglasses, caps and hair gel that produces income for his support.  He’s a hardworking, enterprising, organized man.

This is the fourth loan he’s requested from the Corporación and he wants to use it to buy a new hair wash basin, three hair clippers and assorted merchandise (t-shirts, sunglasses, hair gel) in order to continue to offer excellent service with good work tools and offering a variety of products to increase his sales.  His main dream is to be able to stay in business and to buy an apartment of his own to have better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Exitosas está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, todas integran el programa de eliminación de pobreza, y están haciendo la encuesta para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas, ya que quieren ir superando y mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nilda, Presidenta del grupo, quien en su última encuesta  demostró un nivel de ingreso mayor a la primera encuesta que hizo, todo esto gracias al esfuerzo y al trabajo que está haciendo. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, recibe asistencia  permanente , las reuniones de comité se realiza en su casa, trabaja en forma disciplinada y mantiene excelente pago ,todo esto es acompañado conjuntamente con la asesora de comité,  que al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza y sacar adelante sus familias.
La Sra. Solicita  este crédito para la compra de ropas para su venta, lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, y atrapar mas cliente e  ingresos.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Exitosas” (Successful Women) is in cycle 7 of the women’s committee program. They are all in the poverty elimination program and are taking the survey to get to know the situation each one of them is in because they want to improve and overcome.

One of the members is Nilda, group president, who in her last survey had higher income than in the first survey she took.  All of this was thanks to the effort and work she’s doing.  She works selling clothes and gets permanent assistance.  The committee meetings take place at her house.  She works in a disciplined way and has an excellent payment record.  All of this is done in conjunction with the committee advisor; they encourage the women to strive to overcome poverty and move their families forward.

She is asking for this loan to buy clothes to sell which will help her meet her business plan and to capture more customers and income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Joaiju Group

texts.es:
El grupo denominado Kuña Joaihu, se encuentra en el 8º ciclo, todas cuentan con su actividad comercial en distintos rubros, este grupo con el tiempo ha sido solido, y cuentan con valores como la solidaridad y el compañerismo ya instalado entre ellas, desean seguir creciendo y contar siempre con el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres.
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos que ella misma prepara. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y que tiene una gran habilidad para la elaboración de alimentos y es por eso que le está yendo muy bien. Cuenta que todo lo que hace es para poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan y que de esa forma no les falta nada.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, condimentos, carnes y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo las delicias que prepara y seguir deleitando a la gente que consume sus comidas.
texts.en:
The group called “Kuña Joaihu” is in its 8th cycle.  All of them have commercial activities in various lines of work.  This group has been solid over time and they have the values of solidarity and companionship among them.  They want to continue growing and to always have the women’s committee program’s support.

María is one of the group members.  She sells food she cooks herself.  She’s a very enterprising woman who is a very skilled cook which is why she’s doing very well.  She says that everything she does is to give her family what they need and to insure they lack nothing this way.

She’s asking for this loan to buy vegetables, condiments, meat and other ingredients to continue making the delicacies she prepares and continue delighting the people who consume her dishes.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat and other ingredients.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo tiene un negocio que va creciendo y mejorando el anterior crédito que ha solicitado lo invirtió en la compra de insumos para su local. Es gracias a que esta esforzándose por salir adelante que le esta yendo muy bien.
El solicita de este crédito para la compra de clavos, cerraduras, herramientas y demás productos. El esta muy agradecido por la ayuda que esta recibiendo, ya que gracias a eso ha podido ir mejorando y quiere seguir haciendolo.
texts.en:
Rodolfo has a business that is growing and progressing. The previous loan he requested was used for the purchase of supplies for his store. It is thanks to that loan that he is striving to get ahead and that he is doing very well.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of nails, locks, tools, and other products. He is very grateful for the help he is receiving, and thanks to that he has been able to improve and wants to continue to do so.

loans.use: to buy nails, locks, tools, and other products.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She cites food and fees as her greatest monthly expenses.

She sells Leso (woman's wrap cloth), and has been operational for the last five years. Her potential clients are neighbors and town dwellers. She cites seasonality as a challenge in her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase 10 pairs of Leso (woman's wrap cloth) to sell. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase 10 pairs of Leso (woman's wrap cloth) to sell.

loans.name: Yorodani Group

texts.fr:
Espérance fait partie du groupe  Yorodani  et habite à  Bujumbura. Elle  a 42 ans et est mariée à  Juma, un agriculteur. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants  âgés de 5 à 20 ans, dont 4 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 2 enfants membres de sa famille élargie ; ils étudient.
  
Elle fait le commerce de restaurant (haricot, riz,…), de casseroles, des bassins et des assiettes  depuis  
13 ans. 

Elle est à son  onzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’assiettes, de casseroles et de bassins, à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, elle  voudrait avoir un grand capital et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Esperance is a member of the Yorodani group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 42 years old and married to Juma, a farmer. Together they have five children, aged 5 to twenty years old. Four of the children go to school. She also takes care of two other children from her extended family, who also go to school.

Esperance has been a restaurant supplier (beans, rice, pots, basins, and plates) for 13 years.

She is on her 11th loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy a number of plates, pots, and basins, which she will resell to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to have a lot of money and see her children educated.

loans.use: to buy a number of plates, pots, and basins

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es:
Vanesa viene de una familia humilde,  su marido trabaja en una carpintería y ella en el poder judicial, lo cual le ayuda para poder estudiar su carrera.
La inspiración de Vanesa es terminar su carrera y comenzar a trabajar como abogada  y de esa manera ayudar a varias personas que necesitan y también tener un ingreso más seguro para su hogar. Ella está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, y quiere ser una abogada excelente para ayudar a las demás personas.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en cubrir sus cuotas y también para sus gastos de transportación. Esta agradecida por esta ayuda que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Vanesa comes from a humble family.  Her husband works in a carpentry shop and she works for the justice system which helps her pay for her career studies.

Vanesa’s inspiration is to finish her career and start working as an attorney to help people who need her and also to have a more secure source of household income.  She’s studying Law and wants to be an excellent attorney to help other people.

She’s asking for this loan to cover tuition fees and also to pay transportation costs.  She’s grateful for this help she’s getting.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees and transportation costs.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 33-year-old married man with three children. His wife stays home, taking care of her children.  

Levan’s economic activity is his newly started store, where he sells auto parts and accessories. He started this business several days ago, so it needs support for further development. 

As he lacks experience with the new business and does not qualify under income requirements, local credit providers rejected his loan request. It was approved under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program provides startup and re-startup credits with reduced requirements for the rural poor who do not have access to many credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 
With the amount he is asking for, Levan will purchase more merchandise such as engine oil, headlights, etc. He will renew the assortment and expand his product inventory.

Levan is a very enthusiastic and hard working person, with a great desire to ensure his children receive a good education to progress in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. 

Levan is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for his newly started car parts store

loans.name: Ghulam  Zohran

texts.en:
Ghulam Zohran is a 30-year-old woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for about three years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, facials, hair cuts and hair styles. Through her best services, she has become very famous in her community. 

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetic products for her parlor. Because of low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000. It will help her buy hair care products and skin products with  packs of makeup kits and lipsticks in large quantities. 

She is hopeful of catering to more customers in the future. She is in her third loan cycle, with a good repayment history.
