Es integrante de la Ventanilla Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, perteneciente a la parroquia San Juan de Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas.

Lila se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya y arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar los fertilizantes, insecticidas, herbicidas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en Ventanas. 

El sueño es mejorar el negocio y obtener mejores utilidades, en los tiempos libres le gusta leer y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Lila, 41, lives in a civil union and has two children. She lives with her children and husband in San Franciso in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. She belongs to the communal bank Ventanilla Cevallos, located in San Francisco in San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish, and she is a farmer. 

Lila grows corn, soybeans, and rice and raises chickens and pigs. She has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide. With the loan, she will be able to buy needed farming supplies to protect against pests and disease. She makes her purchases in Ventanas. She dreams of growing her business and profit. She likes to read and listen to music in her free time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide.

loans.name: Hipólito

texts.es: Gracias al crédito que Hipólito obtuvo de Kiva durante la cosecha pudo pagar a los trabajadores que contrató para cortar café pues normalmente cuando comienza la cosecha los productores cuentan con poco recurso debido a que unos meses antes tienen que invertir en fertilizantes y labores de limpieza de sus fincas. También le sirvió para renovar parte de sus fincas ya que las plantas que anteriormente tenían ya no estaban en buenas condiciones. Para esta cosecha Hipólito necesita un crédito para comprar fertilizantes y de esta manera su producción y calidad de su café aumente y pueda tener mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Thanks to the loan that Hipólito obtained from Kiva during harvest he was able to pay contracted workers to cut coffee, as normally when the harvest begins the producers have little recourse in previous months they have to invest in fertilizers and labor for cleaning their farms. It also allowed him to renovate part of his farm that previously had plants that were already not in good condition. For this harvest Hipólito needs a loan to buy fertilizers and iso that his production and quality of coffee increases and he will be able to have better income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Mariuxi Teresa

texts.es:
MARIUXI tiene 25 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y la madre en el Cantón ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, perteneciente a la parroquia San Juan de Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas.

Mariuxy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, fertilizantes, herbicidas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura, El sueño es tener mi negocio propio. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Mariuxi, 25, is single and has two children. She lives with her children and her mother in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. She belongs to the communal bank Ventanilla Cevallos, located in San Francisco in San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish, and she is a farmer.

Mariuxi grows corn, soybeans, and rice. She has applied for a loan to buy seed, insecticide, fertilizer, and herbicide. The loan will let her buy needed farming supplies. She dreams of owning her own business, and she likes to play indoor soccer in her free time.

loans.use: to buy seed, insecticide, fertilizer, and herbicide.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
MARIANA tiene 52 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y el esposo en Ventanas Provicia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, perteneciente a la parroquia San Juan de Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas.

Mariana se dedica a la agricultura a la siemra de maíz, soya, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, fertilizantes, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas. 

El sueño es seguir mejorando en los cultivos para que haya mejores utilidades. En el tiempo libre le gusta ir de paseo por los campos.
texts.en:
Mariana, 52, is married and has two children. She lives with her children and husband in Ventanas in Los Ríos province. She belongs to the communal bank Ventanilla Cevallos, located in San Francisco in San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish, and she is a farmer.

Mariana grows corn, soybeans, and rice. She has applied for a loan to buy insecticide, urea, fertilizer, and herbicide. The loan will let her buy needed planting supplies. She dreams of expanding her cropland to earn more income. She likes to walk through the fields in her free time.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea, fertilizer, and herbicide.

loans.name: Sinthia

texts.es:
Sinthia es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, ella cuenta que está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, con lo cual podrá ayudar a las personas que necesiten ayuda en su salud.
Ella cuenta que su familia siempre la apoya y que su mayor fortaleza. Es también por ellos que se está esforzando, ya que quiere poder ayudarles de la misma forma en que ellos lo hicieron.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar los gastos de su universidad y también poder invertir en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Sinthia is from the city of Paraguarí. She is studying for a degree in nursing, which would enable her to help people who need assistance with their health.

Sinthia says that her family has always supported her and is her greatest strength. They are also the reason why she works hard since she wants to help them in the same way that they did for her.

Sinthia is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the payment of her university expenses as well as the payment of her fees.

loans.use: to pay for her university classes and fees.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is 59 years old and widowed.  She is from Talibon, Bohol. She operates a food selling business, which she has been doing for over 15 years. She makes puso (cook rice wrapped in coconut leaves) and sells it to the nearby eatery. 

Isidra is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more rice and coconut leaves. In the future, she would like to expand her business to be able to improve her livelihood status and save for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase rice and coconut leaves

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 39-year-old married woman from Talibon on the island of Bohol in the Philippines. She has three children aged six, eight and 11 respectively. For almost five years now, she has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for men and women, including shorts, blouses, t-shirts and pants. Aside from this, she also operates a vulcanizing shop for motorcycles. 

Jennifer has requested a loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more clothing and motorcycle spare parts for her businesses. In the future she would like to expand her clothing business to be more successful and also to provide her children with a quality education and healthy diet.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and motorcycle spare parts for her businesses

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth, age 33, is a rice farmer. She lives with her husband and their four children in Talibon, Bohol. Her husband works as a painter. Their eldest child is nine years old and the youngest is a seven-month-old baby. 

In order to be able to continue her farming business, Janeth has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000. She will use her loan funds to buy fertilizers, which will help her to increase her harvest and augment her income. 

In the future, Janeth would like to improve her business so that she will be able to support her growing children as well as she possibly can. Her goal is to provide them with good living conditions and a quality education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice farm

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: Marco tiene 42 años de edad, es divorciado y vive en la casa de sus padres a quienes apoya económicamente. Marco se dedica al transporte, en su mototaxi. Esta actividad lo realiza buscando pasajeros por los jirones y avenidas para llevarlos a sus destinos. Lleva en esta actividad un promedio de 06 años, tiempo que le sirvió para hacerse conocido ya que brinda un buen servicio. Le gusta mucho su oficio por que le permite tener buenos ingresos a parte de darle facilidad de conocer mucha gente e interactuar con sus clientes.Este es su quinto préstamo con Kiva y se sientente contento de saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado 800 soles, comprará piezas y repuestos como llantas, cámaras, rodajes y otros, para arreglar su mototaxi y darle el mantenimiento adecuado.
texts.en: Marco is 42 years old, divorced, and lives in his parent's house.  He supports his parents financially.  Marco has a moto-taxi transportation business. He carries out this business by looking for passengers in the alleys and avenues to take them to their destinations.  He's had this business for about 6 years, and over this time he's become well-known because he provides good service.  He enjoys this line of work, because it allows him to have a good income, and also gives him the opportunity to get to know a lot of people and interact with his customers.  This is his 5th loan with Kiva, and he feels content to know that he has financial backing to continue forward.  Also, he is committed to making his payments on time.  With the sum of 800 Peruvian soles that he requests, he will buy auto parts and supplies such as: tires, tubes, wheel hubs, and other parts to fix his moto-taxi and provide it with appropriate maintenance.

loans.use: to buy tires and auto parts to fix his moto-taxi

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 60 años, es viuda y  vive  en su casa propia junto su sobrino y sus 3 hijos. Yolanda se dedica a  la costura, actividad que aprendió de su hermana.  Decidió iniciar su negocio independientemente, comprando una máquina de coser, empezó cociendo y buscando clientes ella sola, hace más de 15 años atrás. Le gusta su trabajo por el ingreso económico que le genera  para poder pagar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, además que le gusta coser, confeccionar lencería, ropas de todos los géneros y modelos. Se esfuerza para seguir progresando deseando en un futuro comprar su máquina que le facilitaría mucho más su trabajo y crecer en este rubro. Esto es el quinto préstamo con Kiva, y esta agradecida por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo y desea seguir contando con este apoyo, por eso se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de su cuotas, como en los préstamos anteriores. Con el monto de 1500 nuevos soles,  invertirá en la compra de materiales para la costura tales como telas, elásticos, hilos y otros para su negocio.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 60, is a widow who lives in her own house with her nephew and three children. Yolanda is a seamstress, a profession she learned from her sister. Over 15 years ago, she decided to open a business and bought a sewing machine, started sewing, and looked for her own clients. She likes the work because her income allows her to meet household expenses, and she likes to make all kinds of lingerie and clothing for men and women. 

She strives to be successful and someday will buy a machine to make her work easier and help her improve professionally. This is her fifth loan cycle with Kiva. She is grateful for the funding and hopes it will continue, so she promises to make her payments, as she has done with previous loans. With the loan of 1500 nuevos soles, she will buy dressmaking materials like fabric, elastic, and thread for her business.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking materials like fabric, elastic, and thread.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Doña Sofia, se ve en la necesidad de nuevamente pedir un nuevo capital para su pequeña empresa. Dedicándose a la confección de camisas por varios años, la tela que tiene ya no le alcanza y al ver los pedidos de sus clientes se da cuenta que también necesita comprar más colores de tela.  Ella compra la tela por rollos y le cuesta Q 700.00 el rollo. Su esposo sigue apoyándola en todo y los dos han sabido sacar adelante esta nueva oportunidad de levantarse luego del fracaso que tuvieron hace varios años en su negocio, Esta muy agradecida por su apoyo y les bendice grandemente donde quiera que se encuentren, espera que nuevamente le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Sofia needs working capital for her small business. She has been making shirts for some years. She does not have enough fabric on hand to fill customer orders, and she also needs fabric in other colors. She buy fabric in rolls that cost Q 700 each. Her husband still supports her in everything she does, and the two have managed well. This is a chance to start over after their business failed years ago. She is grateful for the support, wishes everyone well, and hopes that they will help her with this loan.

loans.use: to buy materials to make men's shirts to sell.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has three children, ages three, six and nine. Ibrahim has one additional dependent who lives with him to help with the household chores. In 2007, he established a DVD, VCD, CD, mobile accessories, and DVD player business. Ibrahim started his business to become self-reliant after working in the mines. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. Ibrahim works seven days a week, 13 hours a day and earns about 1,114,350 SLL each month.

Ibrahim is requesting a 3,500,000 SLL loan to buy additional empty DVD plates, VCD films, and extension cords. He has previously received and repaid two loans. Ibrahim hopes that his loan will improve his stock and raise his profits. In the future, he plans to open outlets within the town and raise enough profit to construct a home. Ibrahim thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy empty DVD plates, VCD films, and extension cords

loans.name: Elinita

texts.en:
Elinita is married and has four children.  She lives in San Miguel, Bohol.  Elinita is a farmer, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. She helps her husband in tilling their land.

Elinita is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides and to pay for the workers at the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve their farm as well as their harvest. In the future, Elinita dreams of expanding their farm.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides and to pay for the workers at the farm

loans.name: Jacquilen

texts.en:
Jacquilen, age 35, buys and sells dried fish to earn an income. She has been engaged in her business for almost three years and earns PhP 5,000 per month.  

She lives with her husband and their three young children in Getafe, Bohol. 

Jacquilen is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 20,000, which she will use to buy more dried fish to offer for sale This will allow her to better cater to the needs of her customers. 

In the future, Jacquilen would like to expand her business so that she can improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia earns a living through her sari-sari (general store) business. She sells various goods and items in her store, such as canned goods, candies, soda, biscuits, snack foods, soap, and toiletries. 

She and her husband have eight children and live in San Miguel, Bohol.
 
Eufemia is asking for a loan in order to replenish her inventory with such items as canned goods, candies, soda, biscuits, snack foods, soap, and toiletries. With this investment, she will be able to improve her stock and attract more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, candies, soda, biscuits, snack foods, soap, and toiletries to offer for sale

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, age 48, operates a crab fishing business to earn an income. She catches fresh crabs and sells these to members of her local community. She has been engaged in this business for almost 20 years.

Gemma lives with her family in Talibon, Bohol. She and her husband have eight children. Her husband works as a carpenter. Their eldest child is 25 years old and the youngest is 10.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 in order to buy screen material (used for crab nets), rope, and epoxy (an adhesive). These materials will help her to increase her ongoing catch. 

In the future, Gemma would like to expand her fishing business enough to support the college education of her children.

loans.use: to buy screen material, rope, and epoxy in order to make crab nets

loans.name: Jose Jr

texts.en:
Jose Jr is a farmer from the town San Miguel, Bohol. Jose Jr is a married man and has been in the farming business for more than 3 years now. 

Jose Jr is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. Jose Jr hopes of making his business a success and a sustainable source of income through this loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: El cliente reside en la ciudad de Machala.  Hace tiempo atrás un amigo le sugirió que iniciara una actividad comercial, por lo que él decidio dedicarse a ésta en particular.  Trabaja principalmente en las mañanas.  No es casado, pero tiene un hijo que asiste a la escuela fiscal de su barrio.  Le urge utilizar el dinero del préstamo para poder comprar artículos relacionados a su negocio como CDs, estuches, etc.
texts.en: This borrower lives in the city of Machala.  Some time ago, a friend suggested that he start a business, and so he decided to start up this one.  He works mainly in the mornings.  He is not married, but he has a son who attends the local public school.  It is important for him to use this loan to buy products for his business, such as CDs, cases, etc.

loans.use: to buy CDs and cases for his business

loans.name: Jose Abilio

texts.es:
José, es una persona de hogar, vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos. El, se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos y también es albañil, oficio que lo aprendió por cuenta propia y lo desempeña desde hace 8 años.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar más cerdos, concentrado para ellos mismos y también para otros gastos; esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar su actividad con más animales  y lograr aumentar sus ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Su sueño es adquirir su propio medio de transporte y más animales; mejorar su hogar y agregar otro tipo de producción.
texts.en:
José is a homebody and lives with his life partner and two children. He works buying and selling pigs and also as a construction worker - a trade he learned on his own and has been doing for 8 years.

The loan he is requesting will allow him to buy more pigs, concentrated pig feed and cover other costs as well. This investment will help him to improve his activity with more animals and increase his income to help his family.

His dream is to acquire his own means of transportation and more animals, to improve his home and add another type of production.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs, concentrated pig feed and cover other costs.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
Luis tiene 34 años es soltero tiene dos hijos pero no viven con el, el vive solo en San jose de Chibo

Se dedica a la albañeria el credito lo solicita para la comprar de insumos para el hogar ya que no tiene muchas cosas. El credito le ha servido para comprar en efectivo y a un buen precio.

El sueño de Luis es tener salud para seguir trabajando y tener siempre trabajo ya el trabajo es ocacional

En los tiempos libres le gusta visitar a los hijos para salir a caminar.
texts.en: 34-year-old Luis is single.  He does, however, have two children who do not live with him; he lives alone in San José de Chibo.  He works as a bricklayer.  He is seeking a loan to buy household appliances because he currently does not have many.  The loan was useful in enabling him to pay in cash and at a good price.  Luis' dream is to stay healthy enough to continue working and to always have work, because he works on a casual basis.  In his free time, he likes visiting his children to go out for walks with them.

loans.use: to buy household appliances

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, ella es de una familia trabajadora, dedicada y esforzada por salir adelante
Ella cuenta que se meta es obtener su titulo de Licenciatura y ser catedrática, siempre ejerciendo la docencia. Ella está estudiando la carrera de docencia, con lo que podrá ayudar a las personas que necesiten de ayuda en su educación de la misma forma en la que ella está estudiando.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en cuotas de su universidad, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir estudiando y saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
Elisa is from the city of Paraguarí. She comes from a hardworking and dedicated family that has strived to move forward.

Elisa has always been teaching, so her goal is to obtain a degree in Education and become a professor. She is studying for this degree, which will help her assist people who want to be educated. This is the reason why she is pursuing her studies.

Elisa is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her university fees. This will enable her to continue studying and moving forward.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for more than 8 years now. This is the source of their income.
 
Ma. Chona is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve their farm as well as their harvest. 

In the future Ma. Chona hopes of making their business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income.

Margarita is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this she will be able to improve their farm as well as their harvest. 

In the future, Margarita hopes of making their business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She has been in the farming business together with her parents for more than 5 years now. This is the source of her income.

Marissa is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as its harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for more than 5 years now. This is the source of their income. 

Mercedita is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farming business as well as her harvest. 

Mercedita dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She and her husband work their farmland together to earn an income.
 
She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 6,000 in order to buy fertilizer and pesticides. With this investment, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest.

Analiza is determined to make her farming venture a success. Her primary goal is to save enough money to secure the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Ma. Leonisa

texts.en:
Ma. Leonisa is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. 
Ma. Leonisa is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm business as well as her harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business in her place in San Miguel, Bohol. Michelle is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her store and attract more buyers thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 53-year-old married man who has three children with ages ranging from 16 to 18. He describes himself to be faithful and God fearing. He operates a food stall where he sells fried chicken. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a urban area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of price. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy buy more chicken to fry and sell. His business goal is to raise poultry and buy a motor vehicle within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and pay fees for his children.

loans.use: buy more chicken to fry and sell

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a 52-year-old married man who has four children with ages ranging from 18 months to 18 years. He describes himself to be faithful, friendly and focused. He operates a store where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for one year. 
His business is located in a  busy residential area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital and the bad quality of charcoal. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal for resale. His business goal is to expand and have more stores within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mercedes De Jesus

texts.es:
Mercedes, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para seguir en su negocio; este le permitirá  comprar gallinas y pollos para luego venderlos a sus clientes.
El crédito anterior fue de mucha ayuda, ya que las condiciones económicas han mejorado y con las ganancias a logrado aportar para su familia y el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mercedes has the need to ask for a new loan because she requires more working capital to continue with her business; this will allow her to buy hens and chickens to sell them to clients later on.
The previous loan was very helpful because her economic conditions have improved and with the profits she has been able to provide for her family and her children's studies.

loans.use: to buy hens and chickens

loans.name: Khom

texts.en: Khom is in her late 40s and is a villager from Battambang province where she runs her business. She has six children, but only one is a dependent and still in school. She grows rice and sells grocery items as her main income sources. She has had this business for 15 years. Khom has never had a previous loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she is taking out a loan of 4,000,000 KHR in order to buy a plot of land to build a decent house for her family. She hopes her child can have a proper house to live in.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land to build a decent house

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
Mach, 53, is a farmer from Kampong Cham province where her residential area is. She is married and blessed with four children, one of whom is in school. Her three hectares of rice cropping has returned her about 26,600 KHR per day. With this loan, she and her other fellow group members are taking out their second microloan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan to support her business and make her living conditions better than before. Additionally, she can now afford to buy household appliances and keep her kids in school. 

For this cycle, she leads a group of three to apply for a new loan. The total amount for the entire group is 2,400,000 KHR, of which 1,200,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy good rice seed, potash, and to pay for transplanting fees, as well as the plowing fee. She hopes that she can gain a high yield, better than last year.

loans.use: To buy good rice seed, potash, and to pay for transplanting fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sran's Group

texts.en:
Sran is a 40-year-old mother of four kids - three schoolchildren and one little kid - residing in Kampong Cham province. For her kids’ sake she grows rice and raises pigs as the main income. Her supplementary income is also from her husband, who has worked for others for a fee as well. The current business, which she has been involved in for about 15 years, has returned her about 26,000 KHR per day. 

This is not the first microloan for Sran with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the past successful loan, which she has fully repaid back, she feels confident that she can support her living and keep her kids in school. 

With this new loan cycle she is in a group of four as a leader. Sran will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing and transplanting fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to be ready for replanting season and receive back high yields with a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing and transplanting fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha is 40 years old and a mother of two children who are still in school. She deals with the daily cost living via two hectares of rice farming and one hectare of cassava cropping, which is supported by her husband. She is able to earn about 17,500 KHR per day from the business that she has occupied for ages. 

With VisionFund, it is the first time for her. She and her co-borrower, who is also a first-time borrower, are seeking 500,000 KHR each. As the leader she will spend her loan portion to buy potash for her cash-crops. She hopes that she can grow her crops healthily and seasonably so she can make more income to buy a plot of farmland to grow rubber trees for long-term additional profit.

loans.use: to buy potash for her cash-crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sarith

texts.en:
Sarith, age 36 and a villager from Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, is a widowed mother of two children. Nowadays her two daughters are working at the local factory. She earns a living via rice farming; it is the business that she has had for seven years, earning about 13,800 KHR per day. 

Her first microloan was her previous loan. She has succeeded in sufficiently supporting her business and her living conditions in a good place; it is the positive impact of the loan which she has fully repaid back. 

For this cycle she is seeking for a new loan to buy a decent motorbike for her daughter for commuting back and forth to the workplace. She hopes that this purchase will help her to minimize the transportation cost, which her children used to cover.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her daughter.

loans.name: Lidio

texts.es: Lidio pudo aumentar su producción que era de 3.5 toneladas a 4 toneladas gracias a un crédito que obtuvo el año pasado por parte de Kiva. Con el financiamiento pudo comprar fertilizantes y realizar labores de limpieza en su finca. Para esta cosecha Lidio necesita resembrar una parte de su finca y para poder hacer eso necesita nuevamente de otro financiamiento por parte de Kiva. Al final de esta cosecha Lucio tiene planeado adquirir un nuevo terreno para poder aumentar en un futuro su producción de café.
texts.en: Lidio was able to increase production from 3.5 tons to 4 tons, thanks to the Kiva loan he received last year. He was able to buy fertilizer and get his land ready. For this harvest, Lidio needs to replant part of the land, and, to do so, he needs another Kiva loan.  After the harvest, Lucio wants to purchase more land so that he can increase his coffee production.

loans.use: to replant his coffee farm.

loans.name: Luis Jacinto

texts.es: Luis Jacinto sembró planta de café durante la cosecha pasada pues quería aprovechar al máximo la extensión de terreno con que cuenta y lo logró. Estas nuevas plantas estarán dando sus primeros frutos dentro de dos años. Para que todo salga como él lo ha planeado necesita comprar fertilizantes y hacer labores de limpieza en su finca y por eso nuevamente solicita un financiamiento por parte de Kiva el cual pagará al final de la cosecha.
texts.en: Luis Jacinto sowed coffee during the last harvest because he wanted to make the most of his area of land, and he was successful. These new plants will bear fruit for the first time in two years. In order for everything to proceed as planned, he needs to buy fertilizers and tidy up his property. This is why he is applying for another Kiva loan, which he will pay back at the end of the harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and do some work on his property

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo produce dos tipos de café: orgánico y convencional, sin embargo él quiere que toda su producción sea de café orgánico y por eso la cosecha pasada sembró nuevas plantas para ir realizando la conversión. Para que eso fuera posible Marcelo solicitó el año pasado un crédito de Kiva el cual pagó al final de la cosecha. Para este año necesita nuevamente de otro crédito pues aún le falta otra parte de su terreno por renovar la planta y en un lapso de 4 años su producción será totalmente orgánica.
texts.en: Marcelo produces two kinds of coffee, organic and conventional. However, he wants the entire crop to be organic, and to convert last year's production, he had to cultivate new plants. So Marcelo applied for a Kiva loan, which he repaid after the harvest. This year, he needs a loan to replace the plants in another section of land. In four years, his entire output will be organic.

loans.use: to buy new coffee plants for his farm.

loans.name: Adalicia

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Adalicia, quien con su cedikiva pudo comprar materiales de construcción para remodelar su vivienda. Esta inversión a traído una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, su negocio está creciendo, a pesar de la incapacidad de su conyugue, quien se accidentó. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo crédito para invertir en perfumes y productos de belleza, para aumentar su surtido. Adalicia dice a sus financiadores: “Gracias por el apoyo recibido, favoreciéndome al prestarme”.
texts.en:
Thanks to the support she received with her Kiva loan, Adalicia was able to buy construction materials for remodeling her home. This investment resulted in a better quality of life for her family. Her business is growing even though her husband was injured in an accident.

Adalicia is currently applying for a new loan so that she can invest in perfumes and beauty products to increase her inventory. She says to the Kiva lenders, “Thank you for the support I received and the benefit of this loan.”

loans.use: to buy perfumes and beauty products.

loans.name: Isabel Mercedes

texts.es: La cliente reside en Machala.  Empezó tiempo atrás vendiendo artículos varios de puerta en puerta de cada uno de suss clientes.  Al momento lleva las riendas de su negocio sola y lo realiza a cualquier hora del día.  Está casada y también posee una tercena con la que se ayuda en la economía del hogar.  Además tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela fiscal.  Necesita el préstamo para adquirir mercadería para sus actividades como carne, útiles escolares y artículos de bazaar.
texts.en: The client lives in Machala.  She started some time ago selling various items to each of her customers door to door.  At present, she manages her business alone and works any time of day.  She’s married and also has a butcher shop that helps with household economy.  She has two children attending public school.  She needs the loan to buy merchandise like meat, school supplies and household goods for her activities.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Choeng's Group

texts.en:
Choeng, 55 and a widow mother of six children residing in Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, is a rice farmer on two hectares area. She has been involved in the current business for 20 years, earning about 18,900 KHR per day. 

Choeng and her joint borrower have been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past two cycles and have fully repaid the loans. She has succeeded in uplifting her lifestyle better than before. 

For this cycle she is seeking 1,400,000 KHR, while her joint member is applying for 400,000 KHR. As the leader she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She will spend another loan portion to buy pigs for raising for extra income. 

She hopes to double her income and better her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jose, vive con su familia, su esposa y sus hijos , los cuales tienen edades de 12, 14, 16, 18 y 20 años, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 28 años y lo desempeña de 7:00am a  4:00pm, el oficio lo aprendió de su familia.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar los materiales agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a darle mantenimiento al cultivo, el único riesgo es el clima.
Su sueño es adquirir ganado y lograr tener una vida más estable.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his family, which includes his wife and their children (ages 12, 14, 16, 18, and 20). He does not have any relatives who are living abroad. Jose grows basic grains. He says that he has been in this business since he was 28 years old and currently works from 7:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M. Jose learned this trade from his family.

The loan he is requesting will enable him to buy farming materials such as compost, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, fungicides, and other supplies. This investment will help him maintain his crops. His only risk is dealing with the weather. Jose dreams of acquiring livestock and having a more stable life.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, fungicides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Khim's Group

texts.en:
Khim, a villager from Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, is 30 years old and married. She has two dependent children to cater for. For her kids’ sake, she has been farming on a one and a half hectare area for 10 years. Her supplementary income is also from her pig-raising business and fish-catching for resale. 

This is the second microloan for her group, consisting of two borrowers including her. The past loan, which she has fully repaid, has helped her to provide sufficient decent food for her children and improve her living better than before. 

For this cycle she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland for replanting rainy season crops. She hopes that she can gain high yields with a good profit.

loans.use: to plow her farmland for replanting rainy season crops.

loans.name: Sokhon's Group

texts.en:
Sokhon, age 42, is a rice farmer. She grows rice on three hectares of farmland, and this has been her sole income for many years. She earns 11,300 KH per day from this activity. 

Sokhon is unmarried and lives in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. 

This loan will be the third loan for Sokhon and her co-borrower through Kiva partner VisionFund. She is the leader of the group. She repaid her past loans fully and promptly, and the investment from these loans has improved her standard of living. 

For this cycle, Sokhon and the other member of the group are requesting 1,000,000 KHR and 1,200,000 KHR, respectively. Sokhon will use her loan portion to plow her farmland and to buy potash for her crops. 

Her goal is to grow her rice in a timely manner and receive a good yield.

loans.use: to plow her farmland and to buy potash for her crops

loans.name: Rith

texts.en: A young mother age 25, Rith is a citizen from Kror Kor district of Pursat province. She has one child under her care. To support the entire household, she farms rice on two hectares of land as the main source of her income. Her husband generates additional income by producing and selling rice wine and by raising pigs. This is Rith's second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her previous loan wisely to provide daily decent meals for her child. Now, she is seeking 2,000,000 KHR in order to pay the plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes that her rice this season will produce a good yield.

loans.use: To pay a plowing fee

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Esperanza se llama este grupo de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas se encuentra en el 4º ciclo, todas cuentan con su actividad comercial en distintos rubros, este grupo con el tiempo ha sido solido, y cuentan con valores como la solidaridad y el compañerismo ya instalado entre ellas, desean seguir creciendo y contar siempre con el apoyo de la fundación.
La Sra. Jacinta es la presidenta del grupo, su actividad se basa en la venta de Zapatillas bordadas por sus propias manos, vive en pareja en casa propia y también realiza trabajos particulares de limpieza de espacios verdes. Ella es una persona que lucha y trabaja por salir adelante. Es una mujer con muchos deseos y ansias de salir adelante.
La Sra. Solicita  este crédito para la compra de insumos de manualidades, como ser hilos, canutillos, zapatillas, telas, y otros, para seguir haciendo sus zapatillas bordadas y otras manualidades para la venta.
texts.en:
This group from the city of San Ignacio is called “Esperanza” (Hope).  They’re in the 4th cycle and each has a different line of work.  This group has become very solid over time and they possess values like solidarity and companionship among them; they want to continue growing and always having the foundation’s support.

Jacinta is group president.  Her work is selling slippers that she hand embroiders herself.  She and her spouse live in her own house and she also works doing cleaning chores in green areas.  She’s a person who strives and works to get ahead.  She’s a woman who hopes and yearns to get ahead.

She is asking for this loan to buy crafts supplies like thread, beads, slippers, fabric and others to continue making her embroidered slippers and other handicrafts to sell.

loans.use: to buy crafts supplies.

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
MARIA SALOME
ORIGINARIA  SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE DOÑA SALOME de 34 AÑOS DE EDAD, QUIEN DESDE HACE YA MAS DE ONCE AÑOS ES PROPIETARIA DE UNA TIENDA DE CONSUMO DIARIO Y COMO TRABAJO SECUNDARIO SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE POLLOS Y MARRANOS, DOÑA SALOME AGRADECE A FAPE Y KIVA EL APOYO QUE LE HAN BRINDADO PARA SUPERARSE Y ASI AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO A SACAR ADELANTE A SUS HIJOS. ES UNA PERSONA MUY RESPONSABLE EN SUS PAGOS DE PREOCUPA POR TENER SIEMPRE EL APOYO QUE NECESITA, ELLA SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS PRODUCTO Y SURTIR SU TIENDA DE CONSUMO DIARIO Y ASI OFRECERLE LO MEJOR A SUS CLIENTES, ESPERA QUE LE PUEDAN APOYAR EN SU NEGOCIO ATRAVEZ DEL CREDITO.
texts.en: Maria Salome is 34 years old and comes from San Martin Jilotepeque. For more than 11 years she has owned a grocery store and as a secondary job she rears chickens and pigs. Salome thanks FAPE and Kiva for the support they have given her to improve her situation and so help her husband to bring up their children. She is very responsible with her payments and she makes sure she always has the help she needs. She is asking for the loan to buy more products and stock her shop with everyday groceries so she can make the shop the best she can for her customers. She hopes you will be able to help her in her business by providing the loan.

loans.use: to buy everyday groceries to sell.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESPERANZA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sefani es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de dulces y masitas, elaboración de salteñas y masitas, venta de sandwichs, venta de zapatos, venta de artículos varios, venta de deportivos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sefani es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de dulces; este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia utilizando los ahorros que tenía su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de dulces) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Esperanza" will begin its first first loan cycle with Pro Mujer.  As part of the "Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación" [Focal Center of Exaltation Village], the group is comprised of 6 members and is directed by a board headed by President Sefani.  The businesses that members of the association carry forward are varied, including the following: Selling sweets and pastries, making meat pies and pastries, selling sandwiches, selling shoes, selling various items, and selling sports equipment. 

The loan that they will receive will benefit small micro-businessness of which Sefani is a part.  She indicates that this is the first time she has worked with Kiva-partner Pro Mujer, entering upon the invitation of a counselor from the institution who went to her house to visit her.  Currently she has a business selling sweets.  She learned the business on her own initiative using savings that she had from her family.

The loan that she will get is for increasing capital (the purchase of sweets) that she will acquire in the markets of the city El Alto and will later sell from her stall.  This form of work helps her generate income in order to maintain as much as possible her home since she is married and has three kids.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loans.

loans.use: To purchase sweets

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria
La señora Candelaria  de 50 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de Tortillas y productos por catalogo desde  hace seis años su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio en Vista Hermosa y por las tardes ella se dedica a vender  su productos de lociones y maquillajes en su colonia, necesita otro crédito para  poder comprar  maíz ,leña y cal para elaborar sus tortillas  y poder surtir su venta de productos por catálogos,  ella  tiene personas quienes le ayudan a vender, y tambien sus clientes ya conocen su casa para poder comprar sus productos el sueño de ella es seguir creciendo en sus ventas así darles lo necesario a sus hijos y lo primero es  brindarle estudios y agradece a la institución y a Kiva por brindarle la confianza en su persona, le agradese por su ayuda y que Dios los bendiga donde quiera que esten.
texts.en:
Candelaria

Candelaria, who is 50, has been selling tortillas and catalogue goods for six years.  She runs her business from her home in Vista Hermosa and, in the afternoon, sells her lotions and cosmetics around her neighbourhood.  She needs another loan to buy corn, firewood and lime to make her tortillas and to stock up on catalogue goods.  She has other people who help her to sell her goods and her customers know where she lives so they can come and buy from her.  Her ambition is to continue increasing her sales and, as a result, provide for her children - her first priority being giving them an education.  She is grateful to the institution and to Kiva for putting their trust in her.  She thanks them for their help and sends them God's blessing, wherever they may be.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime to make tortillas and to buy and sell tortillas

loans.name: Las Chicas Azucareras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHICAS AZUCARERAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cristina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de material escolar, venta de ropa, salón de peluquería, venta de juguetes, tienda de barrio, venta de refresco, tienda de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cristina es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia hace varios años, al observar que era un buen negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el incremento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación.
texts.en:
The “Chicas Azucareras” (Sugar Producing Girls) communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Cristina.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: school supplies sales, clothes sales, barber shop, toy sales, neighborhood store, soft-drinks sales and grocery store.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Cristina.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for six months having joined thanks to an invitation from a promoter that visited her at home.  She currently has a business selling clothes.  She lets it be known that she started the business on her own initiative several years ago when she noticed that it was a good business.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase working capital.  She will buy clothes in street markets in the city of El Alto and subsequently resell them in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to earn resources to support her home as well as possible since she’s married and has 8 children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto sigue con la misma actividad que es el del servicio de atención de baño público, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de material de construcción para refacción de su domicilio, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de material de construcción pero para la refacción de su negocio ya que constantemente hay que realizar mantenimiento de los baños públicos, se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que está creciendo y mejorando su actividad.
texts.en: Roberto continues with the same activity, which is as custodian for a public restrooms located on his property.  He notes that his previous credit worked well since he used it to buy construction material for the refurbishing of his home.  At this time he is asking for a loan in order to purchase construction material in order to refurbish his business since he constantly has to complete maintenance for public bathrooms.  He feels happy and grateful for the opportunity that is offered since his work is growing and improving.

loans.use: To purchase construction material for the refurbishing of public bathrooms.

loans.name: Lai's Group

texts.en:
Lai, age 32, sells soy milk and bread to earn an income. She has operated her business with the support of her husband for three years. Lai is from the Sangke district of Battambang province. She and her husband have two children.

This will be Lai's seventh loan and her co-borrower's third loan in the same group of two members through Kiva partner VisionFund. Lai is the leader of this group. She has repaid her previous loans fully and promptly, and the investment from these loans has enabled her to build her business into an increasingly stable source of income. 

She and her co-borrower are currently requesting loans in the amount of 1,400,00 KHR each. She will utilize her loan portion to buy soy milk, bread, and coffee to offer for sale. She is confident that she can increase her income through this investment.

loans.use: to buy soy milk, bread, and coffee to offer for sale

loans.name: Roeurn's Group

texts.en:
Roeurn, age 46, is a rice farmer. She has earned her income for many years by farming five hectares of rice crops, an activity that generates about 36,000 KHR per day. She is from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She and her husband have four children.
 
Roeurn has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for seven cycles and has fully repaid her previous loans. The positive impact of her loans has enabled her to improve her family's standard of living. 

She now joins a group of two female members in order to request a new loan from VisionFund. She will use her loan portion to buy potash for her farmland. 

Her goal is to grow healthy crops so that she can gain a high yield and earn a good profit.

loans.use: to buy potash for her farmland

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: Con un crédito obtenido por parte de Kiva en la cosecha pasada María Elena pudo comprar fertilizantes, planta de café, realizar labores de limpieza y resembrar su finca. También le fue posible mantener su producción en 35 toneladas como lo había hecho antes. Para esta nueva cosecha María Elena necesita de otro crédito pues necesita comprar fertilizantes y hacer actividades en su finca. Ella calcula que en unos tres años su producción pueda aumentar a 40 toneladas y con esto mejorará sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
texts.en: María Elena used the Kiva loan she got for her previous harvest to buy fertilizer, coffee plants and to do the weeding and replanting on her farm.  She was also able to attain the 35-ton production she’d had in the past.  For this new crop, María Elena needs another loan because she needs to buy fertilizer and to do activities on her farm.  She figures that in three years her production may be able to increase to 40 tons and this will improve her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and do the weeding.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
Mujeres valientes es un grupo integrado por 15 mujeres de la ciudad de  Caacupé, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que están luchando incansablemente por poder ayudar a sus familias y darles todo lo que no pudieron tener y que no pasen por necesidades.
Una de ellas, y un ejemplo a seguir, es la Sra. Diana, quien se dedica a la venta de chipas, el cual es un alimento típico de Paraguay. Ella es una mujer que se está esforzando mucho por mejorar y por darle a su familia todo lo que necesitan, quieren que tengan todo y que no les falta nada.
Diana solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de chipas y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas y teniendo los ingresos que necesita
texts.en:
Mujeres Valientes is a group made up of 15 women from the city of Caacupé. They are women who are the heads of their families, and who are struggling tirelessly to be able to help their families. They wish to give them everything that they were not able to have and so that they don’t lack necessities.

One of them, and an example to follow, is Diana, who makes a living selling chipas, which is a traditional food from Paraguay. She is a woman who is exerting herself to improve and to give her family everything that they need and want so that they have everything and are not lacking for anything.

Diana is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of chipas, and in this way be able to continue with her sales and have the income that she needs.

loans.use: to buy chipas, a traditional Paraguayan food, to sell.

loans.name: Dame

texts.fr:
Monsieur Dame, âgé de 37 ans, est marié avec un enfant en charge. Dame, s’active dans l’agriculture depuis 3 ans. Il vient solliciter auprès de l’IMCEC un crédit de 200000F CFA  pour acheter des semences et de l’engrais et préparer la campagne agricole. Dame est  actif dans les champs durant toute la journée. Il vient pour la première fois solliciter un crédit pour se stabiliser dans son activité.
Dame s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de la famille et grâce au crédit peut maintenant mettre de l’argent de coté pour mieux s’occuper des conditions de vie de son foyer.
Dans l’avenir, il veut diversifier son activité et faire de l’élevage de bovins.
texts.en:
Mr. Dame, aged 37, is married and has one child to support. Dame has been active in agriculture for three years. He is here requesting a loan of 200,000 francs CFA from the microfinance institution IMCEC to purchase seeds and fertilizer to prepare for planting. Dame is busy working in the fields all day long. He is here for the first time to request a loan for achieving stability in his business. 

Dame takes care of his family's day-to-day expenses. And thanks to loans, he can now put aside some money to take better care of living conditions at home. For the future, he wants to diversify his business and raise cattle.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds to prepare for planting crops

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ousmane, un homme âgé de 65 ans, est toujours actif malgré son âge. Il possède un champ qu’il exploite depuis des années avec l’appui de quelques de ces enfants qui ont aussi pris comme option, ce métier d’agriculteur. Dame est marié et père de 10 enfants. Un crédit de cinq cent mille francs lui permettra d’acquérir des semences et de  l’engrais pour préparer l’hivernage qui pointe du nez. Il gère la dépense quotidienne de sa famille avec l’appui de ses grands enfants qui ont commencé à travailler.
Son souci majeur est d’appuyer tout ces enfants pour qu’ils puissent s’activer à quelque chose et avoir une activité fixe.
texts.en:
Mr. Ousmane, a 65-year-old man, is still active despite his age. He owns a field he has been putting to use for years with the support of his children, who also have chosen this agricultural trade. He is married and a father of ten children. A loan of 500,000 francs will enable him to acquire some seeds and fertilizer to prepare for the rainy season, which is showing some signs. He manages his family's day-to-day expenses with the help of his adult children, who have started to work. 

His major concern is to support all of his children, so that they may be active in something and have steady work.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer to prepare for the rainy season.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina, age 52, raises hogs to earn an income. She also runs a retail store, where she sells items like sugar, coffee, shampoo, soap, noodles, and canned goods. 
 
Saturnina and her husband live in Talibon, Bohol. They have six children: the eldest is 26 years old and the youngest is 14. 
 
She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 8,000, which she will utilize to buy additional pigs. She will also use part of the loan funds to purchase various goods for her retail store, allowing her to further augment her income. 
 
In the future, Saturnina would like to expand her both businesses so that she can improve the family's standard of living. Her goal is to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs to raise as well as a variety of goods to offer for sale in her retail store

loans.name: Adelia Group

texts.es:
La señora Eulalia es de estado civil casada, tiene 32 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, tiene 6 hijos y 3 de ellos estan estudiando, ella se dedica al comercio vende cortes y guipiles típicos, inició este negocio vendiendo ropa ambulante y hasta la fecha lleva 8 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien también se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería: cortes y guipiles, desea en el futuro tener una tienda grande y poder vender no solamente cortes y guipiles como hasta ahora, quiere vender vareidad de ropa. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 32 years old, married, and has never had the opportunity to attend school. She has six children whereof three go to school. She works selling traditional skirts and blouses, she started off as a street vendor and now has eight years of experience with this business. She gets help from her husband who also works in commerce. 

She has organized a group in order to be able to apply for a loan, which she will use to buy her merchandise i.e. skirts and blouses. She hopes that in the future she will have a large shop and be able to sell not only skirts and blouses as she does now, but a variety of clothes. The other members of the group also work in commerce.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Matilde tiene 41 años, está casada y vive en casa de sus padres junto su esposo, su hijo y su hermano. Matilde se dedica a la venta de comidas lo cual lo realiza en el frente de su hogar.  Se inició en ésta actividad  hace más de 1 año y actualmente le ayuda su cuñada en la atención a los clientes. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene sus comidas logrando acabar todo lo que prepara, dejándola buenas ganancias. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual solventar los gastos de su hogar.  Por eso tiene planes y desea ampliar su negocio donde pueda atender más cómodamente a sus clientes. Este es el tercero préstamo con Kiva. Ella esta muy agradecida por el apoyo económico, y promete pagar sus cuotas al tiempo como lo ha hecho antes. Con el monto de 800 nuevos soles invertirá en la compra de ingredientes como papas, aceites, harinas, y otros. También  quiere comprar sillas y mesas para mejor atender sus clientes.
texts.en:
Matilde, 41, is married living in her parents’ house with her husband, son and brother.  Matilde works selling food in front of her house.  She started this activity more than a year ago and her sister-in-law helps her tend to customers.  She considers the business to be quite profitable because her dishes are in high demand; she sells out everything she makes netting good profits.  She likes her business because it allows her to earn income to cover her household expenses.  This is why she has plans and wants to enlarge the business so she can tend to her customers more comfortably.

This is her third Kiva loan.  She’s very grateful for the economic support and promises to make her payments on time like she’s done before.  She will use the 800 new soles to buy ingredients like potatoes, oil, flour and others and she also wants to buy tables and chairs to better tend to customers.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients as well as tables and chairs.

loans.name: Arquimedes

texts.es: Arquimedes tiene 50 años, está casado y vive en su casa propia junto su esposa. Arquimedes tiene un local en un mercado mayorista de la ciudad, ahí espera paciente a que vengan sus clientes en busca de productos. Lleva realizando este negocio por 10 años y lo hace junto a su esposa, que también prepare comidas para vender. Esta actividad le brindan buenos ingresos al día y con ellos puede llevar los productos necesarios y pagar algunas necesidades de su hogar, espera seguir trabajando para hacer crecer aun mas su negocio y en el futuro poner una tienda de productos comestibles en su casa. Este será el segundo préstamo con Kiva, y se compromete a ser un cliente responsable y puntual. Con el monto de 1000 soles, comprará sacos de yucas, además comprará ingrediente e insumos para seguir vendiendo comida en su puesto del mercado.
texts.en:
Arquimedes is 50 years old, married, and lives in his own home with his wife. Arquimedes has a space in a wholesale market in the city. There, he waits patiently for his customers to come looking for products. He has worked in this business for 10 years and he does so along with his wife, who also prepares food to sell. This activity has provided them a good income up until now and with that income he can buy necessary products and pay for some home necessities. He hopes to continue working to make his business grow even more, and in the future open a food products store in his house. 

With the amount of 1000 Nuevos Soles, he will buy sacks of yucca, and furthermore will buy ingredients and supplies to continue selling food in his market stall.

loans.use: to buy yucca and other ingredients to sell food in his food stall.

loans.name: Thao's Group

texts.en:
Thao is 45 years old and married. She is a resident from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province. She has three children: two schoolchildren and one paid worker. To strive for a living, she cultivates rice on one hectare of farmland as her main source of income. She has been involved in her current business for 10 years, earning about 16,000 KHR per day. 

In the group of two, she is the leader. Both of them are new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). They are seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, to plow her farmland, and to clear the bush from the land on which she plans to grow rice. She hopes that she can increase her income and make a good profit so that she can keep her kids in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to plow her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Pou's Group

texts.en:
Pou, age 54 and widowed, is a rice farmer from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has supported herself by farming rice on three and a half hectares of land for the past 10 years. 

Pou is the group leader of this group of two borrowers. She and her co-borrower have been with Kiva partner VisionFund for at least five cycles. She has fully repaid her previous loans, which have helped her to gradually build up her business into an increasingly stable source of income. She is confident that her new loan will help her to continue to improve her livelihood. 

For this cycle, she will use her loan portion to buy potash and insecticide for crops. 

Her goal is to gain a high yield that she can offer for sale at a good selling price.

loans.use: to buy potash and insecticide for her rice crops

loans.name: Chhet's Group

texts.en:
Chhet, age 45, is a rice farmer. She grows rice on two hectares of farmland, and this has been her sole income for many years. As the married mother of 11 children living in Battambang province, Chinet struggles to support her family. 

This is Chhet's third loan with Kiva partner VisionFund. She has fully repaid back her previous loans, and the investment from these loans has enabled her to uplift her family's living conditions. 

She and her co-borrower are now applying for loans in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. Chhet is the leader of the group. She will use her loan portion to buy potash for her crops. Her goal is to boost her crops in enough time to gain back a good yield.

loans.use: to buy potash for her crops

loans.name: Seat's Group

texts.en:
Seat, age 58 and widowed, is a cassava farmer. She has two children and lives in Kampong Cham province. Her cassava-farming business brings her about 13,800 KHR per day.  

Seat is the leader of this new micro-loan group of five borrowers. She will utilize her loan portion to buy insecticide for her farmland. She is confident that she can minimize crop loss due to pests through this investment. 

Her goal is to attain a good yield that she can offer for sale at a good profit.

loans.use: to buy insecticide for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Diogenes Calixto

texts.es:
Diogenes tiene 66 años de edad es viudo vive con familiares en San jose de chimbo Provincia de Bolivar.

Diogenes es profesor de un colegio que se Llama Corina Parral el dinero le solicita para la comprar de electrodomesticos ya que no tiene television para el uso de la casa.

El credito le ayudado a comprar de contado y bajo precio.

El sueño de Diogenes es tener salud y vida.

En los tiempos libres le gusta ir a ver el boli en la plaza.
texts.en:
Diogenes is sixty-six years old and is a widower.  He lives with relatives in San Jose de Chimbo, in the province of Bolivar.  Diogenes is a professor at a high school called Corina Parral.  

The money that he is requesting is for the purchase of electrical appliances.  He currently does not have a television for home use, and the loan helps him to buy with cash and at a lower price.  

Diogenes' dream is to have good health and life.  In his free time he likes to go watch volleyball in the plaza.

loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña Katupyry esta en su tercer ciclo del comité de mujeres, son de Curuguaty, una zona alejada y bastante remota de Asunción. Ellas estan velando y luchando porque para que su ciudad crezca y pueda tener mayor seguridad para sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es Clotilde, quien se dedica a la venta de verduras, animales y todo tipo de insumos agrícolas. Ella es una mujer con muchas ansias de crecer y poder ayudar a su familia por medio del trabajo arduo y sacrificado que hace. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo pueda ir mejorando su comunidad y dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras frescas, y así seguir mejorando día con día en su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
“Kuña Katupyry” is in its third cycle in the women’s committee.  They’re from Curuguaty, a remote zone that’s quite far from Asunción.  They are watching over and striving so that their city can grow and to have more security for their families.

One of the members is Clotilde who sells vegetables, animals and all types of agricultural supplies.  She’s a woman who very much wants to grow and to be able to help her family by means of the hard, demanding work she does.  She hopes that as time passes she’ll be able to improve her community and provide more security for her family.

She requests this loan to buy fresh vegetables to continue improving her micro business every day.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables.

loans.name: Solace

texts.fr: Monsieur Solace est homme âgé de 50 ans, il est marié et père de famille. Il habite à 25 km du Guichet et il est à son 1er prêt. Solace est cultivateur de profession. Il sollicite ce crédit d’un montant de 250.000 pour acheter des semences de pastèque, melon et arachide pour les cultiver pendant la saison des pluies. Il va aux champs à 9h pour ne revenir à la maison que 17h. Solace gère les charges des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. A l’avenir, il souhaite devenir le fournisseur potentiel de fruits et légumes sur le marché local.
texts.en: Mr. Solace is a 50-year-old man who is married and a father. He lives 25 km from the branch office and is on his first loan. Solace is a farmer by trade. He is requesting this loan in the amount of 250,000 francs to purchase melon and peanut seeds to grow during the rainy season. He goes to the fields at 9 AM and doesn't come back to the house until 5 PM. Solace manages his family's day-to-day expenses. For the future, he would like to become a potential supplier of fruit & vegetables at the local market.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon and peanut seeds to grow and then sell the produce

loans.name: Jerusalen De Viacha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JERUSALEN DE VIACHA”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido y trenzado de mantas, venta de comida, venta de productos Herbalai, venta de plátanos y postres, taller de sombreros, venta de productos de nutrición, venta de dulces.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus amigas que son parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia al observar que este comercio es muy activo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo y aceite) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que genera.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Jerusalen de Viacha" or "Jerusalem of Viacha" will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer. As part of the "Centro Focal de Cascada" [the focal center of Cascada], it is made up of nine members and is directed by a board led by President Alicia.  The businesses run by the group members are varied, including the following: weaving and braiding of blankets, selling food, selling herbal products, selling plantains and desserts, making hats, selling nutritional products, and selling sweets.

The loan received will benefit small micro-businesses that that of Alicia. She indicates that she began working with Kiva partner Pro Mujer three loan cycles ago, entering upon the invitation of her friends who were already part of the institution.  Currently she has a business selling food.  She notes that she learned this business on her own initiative after observing, and that her business is very active.

The loan that she will receive is for increasing capital (for the purchase of rice, noodles and oil) that she will buy in bulk in the markets of the city of El Alto and then use to make and sell her product in her stall.  This form of work allows her to generate income to maintain as much as possible her home since she has a partner and a child.

She asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings that are generated.

loans.use: To purchase rice, noodles and oil.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto tiene 45 años, está casado y vive junto a su familia en su casa propia. Humberto se dedica al transporte de pasajeros dentro y fuera de la ciudad. Cuando se inicio en este trabajo manejaba un mototaxi de manera de alquiler, pero ahora pudo comprar su vehículo y trabaja para el mismo, lleva más de 06 años trabajando de manera independiente y le está yendo muy bien. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues genera ingresos diarios para su familia, además que tiene un gran apoyo de su esposa, ahora piensa en poder continuar con la expansión de sus negocio y aumentar mercaderías. Este será el  tercero préstamo con Kiva, y está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto de 1000 nuevos soles realizara el arreglo o cambio de algunas piezas de sus mototaxi.
texts.en:
Humberto, 45, is married living with his family in a house of his own.  Humberto works providing passenger transportation both within and without the city.  When he started in this business he drove a leased mototaxi but he’s now been able to buy a vehicle and work for himself.  He’s been working independently now for more than six years and he’s doing very well.  He likes his work very much because it generates daily family income; besides his wife’s a big supporter of him.  

He’s now thinking about expanding his business and adding merchandise.  This will be his third Kiva loan and he’s very happy to know that he’ll have financial support because he’ll feel sure of making business progress.  On the other hand, he commits once more to make his installment payments.  He will use the 1000 new soles to repair or replace some of his mototaxi’s parts.

loans.use: to order spare parts to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Puits De Jacob Group

texts.fr: Aidé par 04 personnes dans l’exercice de son activité, Mr Komlan est cultivateur de profession. Il exerce son activité en RÉGION CENTRALE depuis 1999. Homme de 50ans, père de famille tous sur les bancs de l’école, Mr Komlan responsable du groupement PUITS DE JACOB dont il fait partie il y a un moment sollicite l’aide de WAGES par un troisième prêt pour s’approvisionner en outils de travail. Il voudrait à l’avenir ouvrir une boutique, augmenter sa superficie cultivable et prendre soin de sa famille. Les autres membres sont aussi dans le domaine de l’agriculture et espèrent qu’avec le fruit de ce crédit prendre en charge leurs familles.
texts.en: Assisted by four persons in carrying out his work, Mr. Komlan is a farmer by trade. He has been working in RÉGION CENTRALE since 1999. A 50-year-old man, he is a father with a family, all in school. Mr. Komlan is the official of the group PUITS DE JACOB, which he recently joined, and is requesting help from WAGES from a third loan to supply himself with work tools. For the future, he would like to open a store, increase his arable land, and take care of his family. The other members are also in the domain of agriculture and hope, with the benefits from this loan, to support their families.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
