Rose, age 56, sells bamboo to earn an income. Bamboo is often used for flooring in the Philippines, especially in houses made of nipa. It is also often used for house fences. She has been engaged in her business for almost 10 years.

Rose lives with her family in Getafe, Bohol. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 in order to buy more bamboo. This will allow her to increase supply and improve her sales.  

In the future, Rose would like to increase her available business capital in order to build her business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo to offer for sale

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en: Nelfa is a 47 year old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has six children. The oldest is 25 while the youngest is eight. She is engaged in a buy and sell business. She buys, and at the same time, sells scrap materials like metal, plastic and empty bottles. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more scrap materials like metals, plastic and empty bottles. In the future, Nelfa would like to save some of the profits to buy a vehicle to use for transportation, which is very helpful in her buy and sell business and she would also like to provide for her family with a good living condition.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials like metals, plastic and empty bottles

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes, age 38, operates a fishing business to earn an income. She and her husband catch crabs and fish and collect sea shells, all of which Mercedes then offers for sale to members of her local community. They have been engaged in this business for over five years, and they work hard to support the family. 

They have two children, ages two and 10 years old. The family lives in Getafe, Bohol.  

Mercedes has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000. She will use her loan funds to buy rope and screen, which she will use to make crab nets. 

In the future, Mercedes would like to expand her fishing business to better support her family. Her goal is to have a sustainable livelihood and to save enough money to secure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy rope and screen in order to make crab nets

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 53 years old, married, and has seven children.  She is from Talibon, Bohol. She operates a retail store, which she has been doing for eight years. She sells items such as noodles, cooking oil, shampoo, soaps, and beverages.   

Mercedes is requesting a loan for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to buy six sacks of rice, two sacks of corn, and two cartons of canned goods.  In the future, Mercedes would like to set aside some of the profits to pay for her children's college education.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of rice, two sacks of corn, and two cartons of canned goods

loans.name: Ma.salvacion

texts.en:
Margaret Salvacion, age 44, offers tricycle transport serves to earn an income. She has operated her business for two years and earns PhP 2,000. She lives with her husband and family in Getafe, Bohol. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 7,000, which she will use to buy fuel and tires and to perform much-needed maintenance on her vehicle, since its current condition causes hassles and delays. 

In the future, Margaret Salvacion would like to expand her tricycle transport services in order to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fuel and tires as well as to repair her vehicle

loans.name: Bharat

texts.en:
Bharat is a dedicated farmer who plants rice on a farm of four hectares. He depends on hiring farming equipment from others, which is very costly and limits the possibilities to fully utilize his four hectares of farmland. The income from the current farming activities is not enough to sustain his family. To make ends meet, Bharat needs to do part-time fishery work. He also works as a part-time domestic servant.

Due to these circumstances, Bharat would like to purchase a secondhand tractor with attached equipment: a Massey Ferguson 185 2WD. With this tractor he will be able to utilize all of the farmland for rice cultivation and will even use the tractor to prepare the ground of other farmers, resulting in additional income. This will enable them to pay for their son's education (he will be entering secondary education soon) and stop doing the part-time jobs.

Bharat has received six loans from Seva in the range of SRD 1,500 to SRD 9,000 for the purchase of fertilizers and pesticides. All the loans are fully repaid. With the profits, he recently refurbished his home and amassed savings amounting to SRD 8,000.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand tractor with attached equipment

loans.name: Gabriel Homero

texts.es:
Gabriel tiene 43 años de eddad, es soltero no tienen hijos vive en San jose de chimbo Provincia de Bolivar.

Gabriel es Empleado Publico el dinero lo solicita para la comprar de un televisor, con el credito ha podido comprar de contado y comprar otras cosas que necesita para la trabajo.

El sueño es tener salud y vidad para seguir trabajando, ademas tener dinero para viajar en avion.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a caminar.
texts.en:
Gabriel is forty-three years old, is single, and does not have any children.  He lives in San Jose de Chimbo, in the province of Bolivar.  Gabriel is a public employee.

The money he is requesting is for the purchase of a television.  With the loan, he can buy with cash and also buy other items that he needs for work.

His dream is to have good health and life so that he is able to continue working, and to also have money so that he is able to travel by airplane.

In his free time, he likes to go on walks.

loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Marlon Eduardo

texts.es:
Marlon tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero. Vive junto a sus padres, su mamá es ama de casa y su padre albañil.

Él Se dedica a trabajar en una librería desde hace 6 meses, es su primer empleo, desde que egresó de bachiller en 2010. Lastimosamente en el país existen muy pocas oportunidades para que los jóvenes puedan trabajar.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de bloques, cemento, arena, para construir con bloque de concreto las paredes y el piso encementado de la cocina de su vivienda. Asi, sus padres y él estarán mas confortables, actualmente las paredes que tienen en el área de cocina son de bahareque y tierra.

Él desea continuar, realizando mejoras a la vivienda de sus padres, aprovechando que ya genera ingresos a la familia, como fruto de su primer empleo.
texts.en:
Marlon is 24 years old and single. He lives with his parents; his mother is a homemaker and his father is a builder.

He has made a living working in a bookstore for six months. It is his first job since he graduated from college in 2010. Unfortunately, in his country there are very few opportunities for young people to work.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of blocks, cement, and sand to construct the walls and cement floor of the kitchen of his home out of concrete blocks. That way, his parents and he will be more comfortable. Currently, the walls that they have in the kitchen area are made of waddle and daub and dirt.

He wishes to continue, completing improvements to the home of his parents, taking advantage of generating an income for the family as the product of his first job.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, and sand to construct the walls and cement floor of the kitchen of his home out of concrete blocks.

loans.name: Guido De Jesus

texts.es:
Guido tiene 37 años es casado tiene 1 hijo vive con la esposa y con el hijo en san jose de chimbo.

Guido es empleado privaddo trabaja en una institucion algun tiempo, el dinero lo solicita para la comprar de electrodomesticos para la casa. El credito le ayudado a adquirir lo que necesita.

El sueño de es tener una vida sin muchas necesidades.

En los tiempor libres le gusta salar a jugar con el hijo.
texts.en:
Guido is thirty-seven years old, is married, and has one son.  He lives with his wife and son in San Jose de Chimbo.  Guido is a private employee, and has worked at an institution for some time.

The money he is requesting is for the purchase of home appliances.  The loan will help him to acquire what he needs.

His dream is to have a life without many needs.  In his free time, he likes to go out and play with his son.

loans.use: to buy home appliances.

loans.name: Florcita De Chonchocoro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORCITA DE CHONCHOCORO”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de queso, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus amigas que son parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa de sus padres quienes trabajaban en esta actividad hace varios años, cuando ella decide tener su pareja emprende su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de vaca) que adquirirá de las ferias de las comunidades aledañas y posteriormente a la crianza comercializará la leche en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que genera.
texts.en:
The “Florecita de Chonchocoro” (Chonchocoro Little Flower) communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Juana.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses like: milk sales, cheese sales and blanket weaving.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Juana.  She indicates that she’s been in Pro Mujer for three cycles having joined thanks to an invitation from her friends who are part of the institution.  She currently has a business selling milk.  She relates that she learned this business thanks to her parents’ initiative since they had worked in this activity for years.  When she decided to get a spouse she started to work independently.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy a cow from livestock fairs in adjacent communities and after raising it will sell the milk in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her home as possible because she’s in a common law relationship and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings she generates.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: 4 Boca Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 4 boca está en su primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, en este grupo también integran mujeres  indígenas trabajadoras, ellas estan haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde (algunas de las señoras se encuentra en la línea y uno y otras en la línea dos de pobreza, es decir en un ingreso muy bajo y otras en un nivel medio).
La señora Matilde es enfermera de la colonia 1° de marzo y es la presidenta en el comité es muy trabajadora y formo su grupo para poder trabajar en conjunto y salir adelante. Está implementando este crédito para dedicarse también a la cría de animales ya que quiere comprar animales de corral y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
Agradecen todas por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo, y que les permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called "4 boca" or "4 mouths" is in its first cycle of the program of "Comité de mujeres" or "Women's committee."  This group is composed of hard-working indigenous women. They are doing the survey related to elimination of poverty (some of the women find themselves living in poverty, and others are on the edge of poverty, that is to say their incomes are very low or medium).  

Matilde is a nurse in the "Colonia 1° de marzo" or "March 1st neighborhood", and she is the President of the communal bank and is a very hard worker.  She formed the group in order to be able to work together and get ahead. She is using this loan in order to dedicate herself to raising animals since she wants to buy yard animals and in that way help her family through her work.

They are thankful for this opportunity that they are receiving, which will permit them to keep growing.

loans.use: To purchase yard animals and in that way begin a new business.

loans.name: Ma. Ana

texts.en:
Margaret Ana, age 30, runs a sari-sari (variety store) business to earn an income. She sells goods like powdered milk, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, and soft drinks in her store. She has been operating her business for almost three years.

Margaret Ana and her husband live in Talibon, Bohol, with their one-year-old baby and their two older children, ages seven and 10.

Margaret Ana has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 8,000, which she will use to buy 10 sacks of rice as well as various other goods to offer for sale in her store. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business in order to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of rice as well as various other goods to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à HAMDALLAYE  un des quartiers de la ville de SAN de la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  et la restauration et de produits divers.
les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 1 er  prêt solidaire. AMI 1 ère femme debout de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 sac de farine de blé, 1 bidon de vingt litres, un sac d’oignon et quelques colis de condiments.
 Elles s’approvisionnent à SAN et les villages environnants. Elles effectuent ses ventes, sur place à SAN, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 500FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of this group called Benkadi have an average age of 40 and on average, five children, and all live in traditional extended families in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods of the town of San of the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. 

These women met through bonds of kinship and they buy and sell foodstuffs such as condiments, or sell cooked food or general merchandise. 
.
The women of this group called Benkadi are on their first solidarity loan. Ami, the first woman standing in the photo, left to right, intends to use her loan to buy one sack of wheat flour, one jerrycan of 20 liters, one sack of onions, and some packets of condiments. She buys her supplies in San and the villages nearby. She makes her sales right in San, to a clientele composed of women and men. 

The women expect to make an average monthly profit of 20,500 F CFA which will be used to cover healthcare expenses, food, and school fees with the rest reinvested in the businesses. .

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Jabier

texts.es: Jabier tiene 37 años, está casado y vive  en su casa propia junto su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Jabier se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de productos regionales como plátano, arroz, y otros. Tiene una chacra propia en donde trabaja  la tierra y lo prepara para tener los mejores frutos y productos, lleva 10 años trabajando con este negocio. Siente que es mucho mejor trabajar de manera independiente porque puede manejar su  horario. Le está yendo bien su negocio ya que siente que cuando hace bien las cosas le da mucha satisfacción, ahora se preparara para poder realizar nuevos proyectos y así poder agrandar poco a poco su chacra. Este será el tercero préstamo con Kiva, Se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Con el monto de 1500 nuevos soles comprará abono orgánico, para fortalecer sus tierras.
texts.en:
Jabier is 37 years old, he is married and lives in his own home with his wife and their two children. Jabier makes his living in agriculture, to be specific, sowing regional products such as bananas, rice and others. He has his own plot of land where he works the land and prepares it to have the best fruit and products. He has been in this business for 10 years. He feels that it is much better working independently because he can manage his working day. His business is going well as he feels that when he does things well he gets a lot of satisfaction.

Jabier is now preparing to undertake new projects and therein expand his plot of land little by little. This will be the first loan with Kiva. As for the previous loans he had, je pledges once again to meet the repayments. With the sum of 1,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles, Javier will buy organic fertilizer to strengthen his land.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his land.

loans.name: Ruth Gardenia

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 32 años es soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Canton Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Rios.

Es integrante de la ventanilla ANCHOVETA se encuentre ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto Anchoveta pertenece al Canton Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agricolas.

Ruth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, soya, arroz las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.

El crédito solicita para la compra de semillas gruesas, insecticidas, fertilizantres y abonos para la siembras. El credito le ayudado para para aumentar los ingresos para la familia. El sueño es tener terrenos para seguir trabajando en la agricultura.

Los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado es la competencia y el mal clima. En los tiempos libres le gusta criar animales.
texts.en:
Ruth, 32, is single and has no children; she lives with her parents in Pueblo Viejo Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Anchoveta” communal bank located in Puerto Pechinche Parish, Anchoveta Recinto belonging to Pueblo Viejo Canton; it does agricultural work.

Ruth works in agriculture growing corn, soy and rice.  She does her purchases and her sales in Ventanas.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy thick seeds, insecticide, fertilizer and manure for her crops.  Credit has helped her increase family income.  Her dream is to own land to continue working in agriculture.  The challenges she’s faces are competition and bad weather.  She likes raising animals in her free time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: José Salvador

texts.es:
José tiene 37 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad que estudia 7 grado. Vive en casa propia  junto a su esposa de 36 años de edad, quien se dedica a los oficios del hogar y su hijo.

Él Trabaja para una empresa de seguridad privada, desde hace 8 años. Anteriormente, se dedicaba a trabajar como jornalero con agricultores y ganaderos de la zona. Manifiesta que en respecto a los ingresos es igual; Pero, en ser empleado de seguridad tiene el beneficio para él y su esposa de gozar del beneficio del seguro social (salud). 

 Los insumos agrícolas los compra en la ciudad y se encuentra a una distancia aproximadamente  de 14 kilómetros, de estos son 5 kilómetros que debe de recorrer por calle balastadas en su bicicleta, debido a que esta comunidad no poseen servicio de transporte público.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas para el cultivo de maíz. Actividad que realiza en sus tiempos libres, ya que trabaja como seguridad un día de por medio.


Con la inversión, busca fortalecer la familia con capital de trabajo para que realicen su cultivo, lo que les permite obtener una cosecha  que le  genere seguridad alimentaría e ingresos extras por la venta del excedente de cosecha y rastrojo para alimentación de bovinos.

Su propósito, es mejorar  la vivienda que poseen, esto es lo principal para el resguardo y seguridad de la familia.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old, in a relationship, and has a child aged 12 who is in 7th grade. He lives in the house he owns together with his wife who is 36 years old and takes care of the household and of their child.

José works for a private security company since eight years back. Before that he worked as a day laborer in agriculture and animal husbandry in the area. He states that the salary is the same, but as an employee of a security company he and his wife enjoy social insurance benefits in the form of health care.

José works in agriculture in addition to his job as a security guard. He buys agricultural inputs i the city, which is at a distance of about 14 km whereof 5 km is gravel road on which he travels on his bicycle, since there is no public transport in this community. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides for the cultivation of corn. With this investment he wants to strengthen the family's working capital for realizing the farming activities. This allows them to get a harvest that generates food security, extra incomes from the sales of surplus production, as well as stubble that serves as cattle feed.

Josés objective is to improve their dwelling, which is crucial for the family's security.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides for the cultivation of corn

loans.name: María

texts.es: El año pasado María recibió un crédito de Kiva con el cual pudo comprar planta, fertilizantes y realizar labores de limpieza en su finca de café. La planta que sembró estará dando sus primeros frutos dentro de dos años. Después de pagar su crédito y otros gastos que tenía pendientes María se pudo comprar un ropero que quería para poder tener ordenada su casa. Para la siguiente cosecha a María le gustaría resembras otra parte de su terreno y para llevar esto a cabo necesita de otro financiamiento el cual pagará al final de la cosecha.
texts.en: Last year María got a Kiva loan that she was able to use to buy plants and fertilizer and to do the weeding chores on her coffee plantation.  The plants she planted will be producing their first fruit in two years.  After paying off her loan and other pending costs she had, María was able to buy an armoire she needed to keep her house neat.  For the next crop, María would like to replant another part of her parcel and to do so needs another loan that she'll pay off at the end of the harvest.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne 34 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN  un des cercles de la région de SEGOU (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de céréales et de produits divers.
les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur 9 eme  prêt solidaire. Josette 1 ère femme debout  de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une importante quantité de céréales (petit mil, mil fonio et maïs).
 Elles s’approvisionnent à TOMINIAN et les villages environnants. Elles effectuent ses ventes, sur place à TOMINIAN, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45 500FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of this group called Danaya have an average age of 34, 5 children, and all of them live in traditional extended families in Tominian, an area in the region of Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) 

These women met through ties of kinship and they buy and sell cereals (grains) and general merchandise. The women of this Danaya group are on their ninth solidarity loan. Josette, the first woman standing right to left in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy a large quantity of cereals, pearl millet, "fonio" millet, and maize.

The women buy their supplies in Tominian and surrounding villages. They make their sales right in Tominian to a clientele composed of women and men. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 45,500 F CFA which will be used for expenses relating to healthcare, food and school fees, and the remainder will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Dori Tominian Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe PARISSI ont en moyenne 48ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN  un des cercles de la région de SEGOU (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires, la restauration et de produits divers.
les femmes du groupe PARISSI sont à leur 8 eme  prêt solidaire. AGATHE 2ème femme debout  de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des douzaines de bidons d’huile de 1 litre des cartons de savons et colis de poissons séchés.
 Elles s’approvisionnent à TOMINIAN et les villages environnants. Elles effectuent ses ventes, sur place à TOMINIAN, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group called  Parissi have an average age of 48 with six children, and all live in traditional extended families in Tominian,  one of the administrative areas of the Segou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) 

These women met through bonds of kinship and they buy and sell foodstuffs, or cooked food, or general merchandise. The women of the Parissi group are on their eighth solidarity loan. Agathe, the second woman standing right to left in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy dozens of one-liter tins of oil, cartons of soap, and packets of dried fish. 

They buy their goods in Tominian and the surrounding villages. They make their sales right in Tominian to a clientele composed of men and women. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 F CFA which will be used for expenses relating to healthcare, food, and for school fees  with the remainder reinvested in their activities.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Maribel tiene 32 años, está casada, y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Maribel se dedica a la vente de gelatinas, flanes, y otros postres en su puesto ubicado en un pequeño local del mercado de la ciudad, lleva realizando su trabajo por 6 años. Cuando se inicio en su negocio solo era ayudante pero ahora puede tener sus propios ingresos que son muy buenos, espera seguir creciendo con lo que hace para más adelante poner un puesto en algún otro lugar de la ciudad. Este será el cuarto préstamo con Kiva, y está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero ya que le avanzar con sus planes de su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera. Con el monto de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará ingredientes, insumos y materiales para continuar con su trabajo ya que le gusta realizar su actividad con eficiencia.
texts.en:
Maribel, 32, is married living in her own house with her husband and three children.  Maribel sells gelatin, flan and other desserts in her stand located in a small space in the city market.  She’s been in business six years.  When she started out in business she was only a helper but now she can earn her own income which is very good.  She hopes to continue to grow so that later on she can open a stand in some other part of town.  

This will be her fourth Kiva loan and she’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial support that will help her make progress with her business plans; she also commits to make her payments.  She will use the 1,000 new soles to buy ingredients, supplies and materials to continue in business since she likes to do her work efficiently.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, supplies and materials.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta, age 37, is a fish vendor. She sells various kinds of fresh fish to members of her local community to earn an income. She lives in Getafe, Bohol, with her husband and their three children. Their children are ages five, eight, and 14 years old. 

Julieta has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 in order to buy more fresh fish to resell. She will also use a portion of her loan funds to pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, Julieta would like to expand her fish vending business so that she can better provide her children with good food and a quality education.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to offer for sale as well as to pay her children's school fees

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es: Durante el año pasado María Guadalupe logró aumentar su producción de 8 a 9 toneladas gracias a un crédito obtenido por parte de Kiva con el cual compró fertilizantes y realizó labores de limpieza y preparación de sus terrenos. Para este año ella necesita nuevamente de otro financiamiento para comprar más fertilizantes y algunas plantas para renovar parte de su finca.
texts.en: María succeeded in increasing production from 8 tons to 9 tons this past year thanks to the Kiva loan she got that she used to buy fertilizer and to do the weeding and soil preparation on her and.  For this year, she needs a new loan again to buy more fertilizer and some plants to renovate part of her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and coffee plants.

loans.name: José Eduardo

texts.es:
José tiene 25 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo de un año de edad. Él desarrolla la actividad de producción de granos básicos y también  de sandia, esta labor la aprendió de su padre quien desarrollaba esa actividad, don José vive junto a su esposa y su hijo compra los materiales para la producción agrícola en  la ciudad  y los traslada unos 12 kilómetros hasta su vivienda donde los almacena para luego aplicarlos a las plantas para su producción.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono e insecticidas para la protección de las plagas de las plantas para obtener una mayor producción al  satisfacer una mayor producción y por ende mayores ingresos económicos para la sostenibilidad familiar así como proveer de un buen producto  para sus clientes 

Espera, tener una mayor producción al disponer de los fertilizante para poderlo aplicar en el momento que los necesitan las plantas. planea tener una actividad que sea rentable para sus clientes y también una buena estabilidad familiar que le permita tener las condiciones necesarias y darle a su hijo una buena educación
texts.en:
José, 25, has a spouse and a one-year-old son.  He works growing basic grains and watermelon.  He learned this activity from his father who did the same kind of work.  José lives with his wife and son and buys all his agricultural supplies in the city and transports them about 12 kilometers to his house where he stores them until they are needed for his plants.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy manure and insecticide to protect the plants from infestations in order to obtain larger crop yield and larger production thus higher income for family support as well as providing good product for his customers.

He hopes that by having fertilizer available to apply at the right moment when the plants need it he’ll get higher crop yields.  He plans to have an activity for his customers that is profitable and also to have good family stability that will allow him to have the conditions necessary to give his son a good education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Cirina

texts.es: Gracias al crédito de kiva Cirina pudo comprar planas nuevas para resembrar una parte de su finca ya que tenia algunas plantas viejas que ya no generaban buena cosecha, ahora Cirina necesita un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos ya que estos le ayudaran a que sus plantas crezcan fuertes y su producción aumente considerablemente y con ello tener una mejor cosecha este año mejorando con ello mayores ganancias económicas mejorando con ello su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Thanks to her Kiva loan Cirina was able to buy new plants to replant part of her farm because some of the plants were old and no longer producing good harvests.  Now Cirina needs a loan to buy organic fertilizer because it will help her plants to grow strong and her production will increase considerably thus yielding a better harvest this year which will lead to improved profits thus improving her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SOUTOURA ont en moyenne 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN  un des cercles de la région de SEGOU (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires, la restauration et de produits divers.
les femmes du groupe SOUTOURA sont à leur 5 eme  prêt solidaire. SABINE 1 ère femme debout  de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  des  pièces de pagnes wax, des douzaines de  chaussures pour femmes et des cartons de savons.
Elles s’approvisionnent à TOMINIAN et les villages environnants. Elles effectuent ses ventes, sur place à TOMINIAN, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Soutoura group are 45 years old on average, and have an average of five children. They all live in traditional extended families in Tominian, one of the districts in the region of Segou (the 4th administrative region of Mali).

The women are all related and their business activities include trading food products, catering and dealing in various other products.

This is the fifth solidarity loan for the women in the Soutoura group. Sabine, pictured standing on the right, is hoping to use her loan to buy pieces of traditional wax cloth pagnes, dozens of women’s shoes and some boxes of soap.

The women buy their supplies in Tominian and the surrounding villages. They sell their goods locally in Tominian to both men and women customers.

They are hoping to make a monthly average of 60 000 CFA francs, which will be spent on healthcare, food, school fees and reinvesting in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy various goods.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SIGUIDIA ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA chef lieu de commune du cercle de SAN de la  quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  et la restauration et de produits divers.
les femmes du groupe SIGUIDIA sont à leur 1 er  prêt solidaire. ASSETOU 1 ère femme debout de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 bidon de vingt litres huile, un sac d’oignon et bien d’autres petits condiments.
 Elles s’approvisionnent à SAN et les villages environnants. Elles effectuent ses ventes, sur place à KIMPARANA, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 500FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Siguidia group are 40 years old on average, and have an average of four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Kimparana, one of the neighbourhoods in the cercle of San (in the 4th administrative region of Mali).

The women are all related and are involved in trading food products, such as condiments, catering and selling other goods.

This is the first solidarity loan for the women in the Siguidia group. Assetou, pictured standing on the far left, is hoping to use her loan to buy one 20-liter can of oil, a bag of onions and many other condiments.

The women buy their supplies in San and the surrounding villages. They sell their goods locally in Kimparana to both men and women customers.

They are hoping to make a monthly average of 30 500 CFA francs, which will be spent on healthcare, food, school fees and reinvesting in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Benkadi  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 8 membres du groupe  Benkadi 1 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à KAMPOGOSSO, un des villages de la commune de Kimparana  cercle SAN, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur 4eme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  maïs  avec  MOUSTAPHA,  1er debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  3,5 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, à Kimparana et à SAN, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi faire face aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Benkadi I group are married men. On average, they are 45 years old and have six children. They all live in traditional families in Kampogosso, one of the villages in Kimparana in the San cercle (in the 4th administrative region of Mali). 

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to maintain their farming activities over the rainy season. 

This is their fourth loan with the institution and all their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Moustapha, pictured standing on the far left, grows maize. He will use his loan to buy farm inputs, seed and minor agricultural equipment, as well as pay the labour costs to maintain 3.5 hectares. 

After harvest, the produce is sold in the village, in Kimparana and San, to both men and women customers.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs and purchase farm inputs, minor agricultural equipment and seed.

loans.name: Djiguisseme  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à KAMPOGOSSO, un des villages de la commune de KIMPARANA cercle de SAN de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5 eme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  KARIYA,  1ere debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo ( présidente du groupe ).
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Kimparana, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
NB : MAKARIYA  absente pour couse de maladie ( luxation au niveau du pied ).
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djiguisseme I group are married women. On average, they are 41 years old and have five children. They all live in traditional families in Kampogosso, one of the villages in Kimparana in the San cercle (in the 4th administrative region of Mali). 

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to maintain their farming activities over the rainy season. 

This is their fifth loan with the institution and all their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Kariya (the group leader), pictured standing on the far left, grows groundnuts. She will use her loan to buy farm inputs, seed and minor agricultural equipment, as well as pay the labour costs to maintain 1.5 hectares. 

After harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Kimparana, to both men and women customers. 

Kariya is hoping to make 45 000 CFA francs by the end of the campaign. This money will help her to pay off the loan and help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

NB: Makariya is absent from the photo due to a foot injury.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy farm inputs, minor agricultural equipment and seed.

loans.name: Djiguisseme  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  DJIGUISSEME 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans ,4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à KAMPOGOSSO, un des villages de la commune KIMPARANA cercle de SAN, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5 eme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  FATOUMATA SEYDOU  ,  3eme femme débout de la gauche vers la droite    sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Kimparana, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djuguisseme 2 group are married women. On average, they are 41 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional families in Kampogosso, one of the villages in Kimparana in the San cercle (in the 4th administrative region of Mali). 

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to maintain their farming activities over the rainy season. 

This is their fifth loan with the institution and all their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Fatoumata Seydou, pictured standing third from the left, grows groundnuts. She will use her loan to buy farm inputs, seed and minor agricultural equipment, as well as pay the labour costs to maintain 0.5 hectares. 

After harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Kimparana, to both men and women customers. 

Fatoumata Seydou is hoping to make 150 000 CFA francs by the end of the campaign. This money will help her to pay off the loan and help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and purchase farm inputs, minor agricultural equipment and seed.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Curuguaty,  se formó en el barrio las Mercedes, se denominaron como (Virgen la Mercedes) está en su  tercer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son de una ciudad un poco alejada que está luchando por crecer, dar mayor seguridad para todas las personas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ninfa, quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, que ella misma hace y lo cual es muy solicitado. Comenta también que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, y que día a día está mejorando, cuenta además que todo su esfuerzo es para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir preparando sus comestibles, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos, pollo y demás insumos. Agradece por esta ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Curuguaty, it was established in the Las Mercedes neighborhood, and it goes by the name of Virgen la Mercedes. The group is in its third loan cycle of the women's communal bank. They are from a city which is a bit distant and is fighting to grow, to give better safety to all people.

One of the members in Ninfa who makes her living selling all types of food which she makes and is very much sought after. Ninfa comments that she also has gained a very good customer base, and that every day it is improving. She also speaks of how all of effort goes into helping her family via her work.

She is seeking this loan to invest in the purchase of supplies to continue preparing her dishes such as meat, vegetables, sauces, chicken and other supplies. She is grateful for the help that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, sauces, chicken and other supplies.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La Sra. Dominga tiene 61 años de edad, es de la ciudad de Itá, está casada con el Sr. Robustiano, y tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad.
Ella se dedica al comercio, tiene una despensa en su casa hace como 17 años, cuenta que anteriormente realizaba diversos tipos de trabajo para sacar adelante a su familia que gracias al esfuerzo de cada día sobresalieron a los diversos problemas que se les presentaba en la vida.
Doña Dominga trabaja con la institución del año 2006, en esta oportunidad solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos de primera necesidad para surtir su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, y demás.
texts.en: Dominga is 61 years old. She lives in the town of Itá and is married to Robustiano, with whom she has three children, who are all grown up. She has had a shop in her house for some seventeen years. Dominga tells us that she used to do odd jobs to help her family and that thanks to every family member's efforts, they managed to pull through and overcome the many problems they faced in life. Dominga has been working with the field partner since 2006, and she asks for a loan to buy basic items to sell, such as fruit, vegetables, and other items.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en: Gleceria is a 47-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has eight children. The youngest child is 13. She operates a business selling gasoline. Her husband works as a carpenter. Gleceria wanted to have capital for her business, so she requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy more gasoline and to pay her children's school fees. In the future she hopes that she will be successful in order to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and to pay school fees

loans.name: Marta Funciana

texts.es:
Marta tiene 71 años de edad de estado civil viuda tiene 4 hijos vive con los hijos en el Canton Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Rios.
 
Es integrante de la Ventanilla ANCHOVETA se encuentre ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto Anchoveta pertenece al Canton Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agricolas. 

Marta se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, arroz, ademàs se dedica a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas, abonos. El crèdito le ayudado a suplir las necesidades y obtener mejores ingresos para el bienestar de la familia. El sueño es comprar una casa y terrenos.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia y el mal clima. En los tiempos le gusta leer y pasear.
texts.en:
Marta, 71, is a widow and has four children she lives with in Pueblo Viejo Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Anchoveta” communal bank located in Puerto Pechinche Parish, Anchoveta Recinto belonging to Pueblo Viejo Canton; it does agricultural work.

Marta works in agriculture growing corn and rice and also raises animals.  She is asking for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea, insecticide and manure.  The loan has helped her meet her needs and earn higher income for family well-being.  Her dream is to buy a house and land.  The challenges she faces are competition and bad weather.  She likes to read and go for excursions in her free time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Angel Miguel

texts.es:
Angel tiene 70 años es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en san jose de chimbo.

Angel es jubilado el dienro lo solicita para la comprar de electrodomesticos para la casa.

Con el dienro ha podido comprar lo necesario.

El sueño es tener siempre salud para ver crecer a su ñieta.

En los timepos libres le gusta dorir.
texts.en: Ángel, 70, lives with his wife and children in San José de Chimbo.  He’s retired and requests the money to buy home appliances for his house.  He’s been able to buy what’s needed with the money.  His dream is to stay healthy to watch his granddaughter grow up.  He likes to sleep in his free time.

loans.use: to buy home appliances.

loans.name: Johanna Mercedes

texts.es:
Johanna tiene 31 años es soltera tiene 1 hijo vive con el hijo en el Canton Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Rios. 

Es integrante de la Ventanilla ANCHOVETA se encuentre ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto Anchoveta pertenece al Canton Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agricolas. 

Johanna se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, soya, arroz las compras y las ventas lo hace en la ciudad de ventanas. 

El credito solicita para la compra de semillas, ranger, fertilizantes y abonos . El credito le ha servido para aumentar los ingresos de la familia. El sueño es tener un propio regadio.

Los desafios a los que se ha enfrentado son las plagas y el mal clima. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte en especial el indor.
texts.en:
Johanna, 31, is single and has a son she lives with in Pueblo Viejo Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Anchoveta” communal bank located in Puerto Pechinche Parish, Anchoveta Recinto belonging to Pueblo Viejo Canton; it does agricultural work.

Johanna works in agriculture growing corn, soy and rice.  She makes her purchases and her sales in the city of Ventanas.  She is asking for the loan to buy seeds, Ranger [herbicide], fertilizer and manure.  The loan has helped her to increase family income.  Her dream is to have her own irrigated land.  The challenges she faces are infestations and bad weather.  She likes to play sports in her free time, especially Indor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 34 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos de cuatro y dos años de edad respectivamente. Cuenta con 14 años de experiencia en la fabricación de estructuras metálicas y desde hace 8 años instalo su propio taller. Este oficio lo aprendió de su padre. Todos los insumos que necesita para fabricar sus pedidos, los adquiere en la ciudad a unos 15 kilómetros de su casa, por lo que se en la necesidad de pagar un transporte privado para hacerlos llegar a su taller.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar hierro y demás materiales para fabricar ventanas, puertas, balcones, entre otros cuando se lo soliciten los clientes. De esta manera dispondrá de suficiente material, para cuando lleguen trabajos urgentes y no dejar ir a los clientes. Su propósito es mejorar la intención a los clientes, construir su propia casa, brindarle el estudio a sus hijos y que su negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Pedro, 34, has a spouse and two children who are 4 and 2 years old respectively.  He has 14 years’ experience making metal structures and for the last 8 years has had his own shop.  He learned this occupation from his father.  He gets all the supplies needed to manufacture what’s ordered in the city about 15 kilometers from home which is why he needs to pay private transport service to get them to his workshop.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy iron and other supplies needed to manufacture windows, doors and balconies, among other things requested by customers. In this way he’ll have enough material so that when urgent orders come in he won’t lose customers.  His goal is to improve customer service, to build a house of his own and to provide education for his children and that his business grows more every day.

loans.use: to buy iron and other supplies.

loans.name: Mirna Abigail

texts.es:
Mirna tiene 18 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de un año de edad. Ella realiza la actividad de oficios domésticos ya que vive unto a su hijo de un año de edad y su esposo quien trabaja en la producción agrícola y es la persona que sostiene a la familia.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar arena, cementó y hierro para la construcción y la elaboración de una puerta de acceso a la vivienda. Así, poseerá una casa con  las condiciones para la estabilidad de su hijo y su familia ya  con esfuerzo han logrado construir una parte; pero le falta complementar y tiene el deseo de mejorarla. Su deseo es brindar el estudio a su hijo y lo necesario para que se desarrolle bien.
texts.en:
Mirna, age 18, is married and has a one year old child.  She does the domestic chores because she lives together with her one year old child.  Her husband works in agricultural production, and he supports the family.

The loan that she is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy sand, cement, and iron to build a door  to her house.  This way she will have a secure house for her child and her family.

With effort, they have managed to build part, but it is not finished, and she wishes to improve it.  Her wish is to give her child an education and whatever is needed to grow up well.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and iron to build a door  to her house.

loans.name: Al-Awfia Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Awfia and is made up of four women living in Taiz, Yemen. Together, they are requesting a loan in the amount of 120,000 YER. 

Ebtsam, age 25, is the leader of the Al-Awfia group. She and her husband have three children and live in Taiz. Ebtsam is a stay-at-home mother whose main hardship is lack of money. Her family is currently in need of a new refrigerator, so she is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 YER from AMB. With the loan funds, she will buy a fridge. Her goal is to offer her family a good life.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for her family

loans.name: Maria Lucia Rogelia

texts.es: Durante la cosecha pasada María Lucia Rogelia sembró planta nueva y ya cuenta con un total de 3000 plantas en su finca. Esto fue posible gracias a un crédito obtenido por parte de Kiva. Con esto podrá aumentar su producción de café orgánico que actualmente es de 3 toneladas. Para esta cosecha nuevamente solicita un financiamiento de Kiva pues necesita comprar fertilizantes y realizar labores de limpieza y preparación del terreno para sembrar nueva planta.
texts.en: María Lucia Rogelia planted new plants during the previous growing cycle and now has a total of 3000 plants on her farm.  This was possible due to the loan obtained from Kiva.  She will now be able to increase organic coffee production that’s currently 3 tons.  For this crop she once again is requesting a Kiva loan because she needs to buy fertilizer and to do the weeding chores and to prepare the soil to plant new plants.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and weed her parcel.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. This picture is taken in their new home.

Sana is a 42-year-old married woman. She is a mother with seven children: five sons and two daughters. Sana and her husband and children live in a humble house in a small village called Attel near Tulkarm city. Sana's husband is a worker in a bakery in the city. He earns a low income which is not enough to cover all the expenses for the family's needs. 
 
Sana and her husband would like to complete their new home and live in it, but they do not have enough liquidity to pay the costs of completing it. Sana took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Sana to purchase construction materials to complete the family's new home so they can enjoy living in a comfortable place.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en:
Gelyn, age 27, runs a sari-sari (variety store) business. In her store, she sells a variety of items such as eggs, sugar, biscuits, coffee, seasonings, and canned goods.

Gelyn lives in Getafe, Bohol, with her husband and their children. They have a one-year-old baby and two older children, ages eight and nine.
 
In order to be able to restock her store with various necessary items, Gelyn has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 8,000. She will use her loan funds to buy condiments and soft drinks to offer for sale.

Gelyn hopes to expand her business so that she can provide her children with nutritious food and good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy items condiments and soft drinks to offer for sale

loans.name: Adrian Arturo

texts.es:
Adrian tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Canton Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Rios. 

Es integrante de la Ventanilla ANCHOVETA se encuentre ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto Anchoveta pertenece al Canton Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agricolas. 

Adrian se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz,arroz y soya. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en la ciudad de ventanas. 

El crédito solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, insecticidas, herbicidas. El credito le ayudado a suplir las necesidades y aumentar los ingresos de la familia. El sueño es tener dinero para tener un riego propio para los cultivos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en los cultivos. En los tiempos le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Adrián, 21, is single and has no children; he lives with his parents in Pueblo Viejo Canton, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “Anchoveta” communal bank located in Puerto Pechinche Parish, Anchoveta Recinto belonging to Pueblo Viejo Canton; it does agricultural work.

Adrián works in agriculture growing corn, rice and soy.  His purchases and sales take place in the city of Ventanas.  He needs the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide and herbicide.  The loan has helped him meet his needs and increase family income.  His dream is to have money to have his own irrigation system for his crops.  The challenge he faces are crop pests.  He likes to play sports in his free time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Edilma Luicina

texts.es:
Edilma tiene 53 años es casada vive con el esposos y con los hijos en san jose de chimbo.

Edilma es empleada privada el dinero lo solicita para la compra de electrodomesticos para la casa, el credito el ayudado para la comprar en efectivo.

El sueño  de edilma es tener mayores ingresos para comprarse un terreno-.

En los tiempos libres le gusta caminar.
texts.en: Edilma, 53, lives with her husband and children in San José de Chimbo. She’s a private employee and requests the money to buy appliances for the house; the loan has helped her to pay cash for her purchases.  Edilma’s dream is to earn higher income to buy land.  She likes to walk in her free time.

loans.use: to buy home appliances.

loans.name: Alexandra Azucena

texts.es:
Alexandra tiene 43 años de edad es viuda, tiene 4 hijos vive con los padres y los hijos en el Canton Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Rios. 

Es integrante de la Ventanilla ANCHOVETA se encuentre ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto Anchoveta pertenece al Canton Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agricolas. 

Alexandra se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, arroz, soya, ademàs se ededica a ala crianza de pollos. Las compras y las ventas las realiza en ventanas. El crédito Solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, insecticidas, hericidas. 

El credito le ayudado para comprar los fertilizantes. El sueño es tener su propio regadio para los cultivos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el mal clima y la competencia. En los tiempos libres le gusta pasear y leer libros de agricultura.
texts.en:
Alexandra, 43, is a widow with four children; she lives with her children and parents in Pueblo Viejo Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Anchoveta” communal bank located in Puerto Pechinche Parish, Recinto Anchoveta, belonging to Pueblo Viejo Canton; it does agricultural work.

Alexandra works in agriculture growing corn, rice and soy and also raises chickens.  Her purchases and sales take place in Ventanas.  She requests the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide and herbicide.

The loan has helped her buy fertilizer.  Her dream is to have her own irrigation system for the crops.  The challenges she faces are bad weather and competition.  She likes to go on excursions and to read books on agriculture in her free time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Julio Eduardo

texts.es:
JULIO tiene 41 años de edad es casado tiene cuatro hijos, vive con los hijos y la esposa en el cant´´on Ventanas Provicnia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, perteneciente a la parroquia San Juan de Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas.

JULIO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, urea, una bomba. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta y la bomba para poder fumigar la maleza. Las compras las realiza en Ventanas.
El sueño es llegar a ser un buen empresario. En el timepo libre le gusta leer mucho.
texts.en:
Julio is 41 years old. He is married and has four children. He lives with his wife and kids in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.

He belongs to Ventanilla Cevallos, a solidarity group located in Recinto San Francisco, which belongs to the parish of San Juan de Pueblo Viejo, a community of farmers.

Julio works in agriculture. He grows corn, soy, and rice. He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, weed-killers, urea, and a pump. This loan will help him buy the supplies he needs and a pump to fumigate the weeds. He makes his purchases in Ventanas.

His dream is to become a good businessman. In his spare time he very much enjoys reading.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, weed-killers, urea, and a pump.

loans.name: Palomitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PALOMITAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Flora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: trenzado de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de fruta, venta de artículos varios, macramé de mantas, tejido de chompas, venta de salchipapas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Flora es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne; este negocio lo emprendió por enseñanza de su cuñada y que para emprender el negocio utilizando los ahorros.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, la capacitación y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Palomitas” (Little Doves) communal bank will start the first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Focal Center.  It has 7 members led by a governing board presided over by Flora.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses: blanket weaving, neighborhood store, fruit sales, assorted goods sales, macramé blankets, sweater knitting and ‘salchipapas’ [fried sausage with fried potatoes] sales.

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Flora who indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for two cycles having joined thanks to an invitation from one of the institution’s advisors that came to visit her at home.  She currently has a business selling meat.  She started it thanks to instruction from her sister-in-law and using her savings.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy meat in the city of El Alto’s street markets and then sell it in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her home as possible since she has a common law spouse and two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit, the training and the health services.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.en:
Ramzi is a 32-year-old, married man. He lives in a small house in Rafah city with his wife and two young daughters. 

Ramzi works as an employee in the public sector with a very low wage, so he also works in a restaurant which sells traditional meals.

Ramzi took a USD Murabah loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy some necessary home appliances, especially a refrigerator and an oven. By applying for this loan, he will be able to improve the living conditions for his family.

Ramzi would like to take more loans in the future, to buy all the necessary home appliances for his house. In the photo, Ramzi appears in the shop where he would like to buy the home appliances.

loans.use: to buy some necessary home appliances, especially a refrigerator and an oven.

loans.name: Eufrido Euclides

texts.es:
EUFRIDO tiene 45 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC ANCHOVETA se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Recinto Anchoveta, pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas.

Eufrido se ddeica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, fertilizantes, herbicidas. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas.  Con la ayuda del crédito podrá incrementar el negocio.
El sueño es  tener un regadío propio para los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer ejercicios.
texts.en:
Eufrido is 45 years old and is married with one child, both of whom he lives with in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos. 

He is a member of the Anchoveta Communal Bank which is located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche in the district of Anchoveta. He lives in the Pueblo Viejo county where he carries out agricultural activities. 

Eufrido makes a living planting corn and rice. He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, and herbicides. These purchases will be made in Ventanas. With the help of this loan he will be able to grow his business. His dream is to have his own irrigation system for the crops. In his free time he likes to exercise.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, and herbicides.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.en:
Albertina owns and operates A.L. Photography in New Iberia, Louisiana. Beginning as a hobby, Albertina’s photography soon grew into a passion – and then into a profitable business. She focuses on wedding, graduation and family photos.
 
Albertina’s disposable income is now invested in start-up fees for her seven-month-old enterprise. As she looked to grow, she found herself in need of an equipment upgrade.

After hearing about non-profit microlender Accion Texas Inc. from an active Accion client, she inquired about a loan and was approved for $5,450. The loan helps Albertina offer more services and, therefore, the ability to secure more photography contracts.

Without the loan, Albertina says she would have had to continue working with the equipment she currently owns, limiting the amount of possible work and business income. 

The 40-year-old entrepreneur is also the sole proprietor, but she hopes to hire two part-time employees in the near future. For now, her plans are to expand her offerings and increase her clientele.

loans.use: to update her photography equipment and offer more services.

loans.name: Tamawe Group

texts.fr: Aidé par des personnes dans l’exécution de son activité (agriculture) Mr Katawili est né en 1965. Il est marié à une cultivatrice et ont ensemble 18 enfants dont 15 scolarisés. Il est à son quatrième crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour s’approvisionner en outils de travail afin d’avoir un bon rendement. Notons qu’il est dans ce domaine il y a 31ans et il maitrise bien les saisons pour savoir qu’elle récolte faire en cette période. Toute son activité est basée en RÉGION CENTRALE et il s'y plait bien car cela lui permet de nourrir la population en générale et sa famille en particulier. Avec les profits réalisés, il souhaiterait construire un logement, augmenter la superficie cultivable et prendre soin de la famille. Tous sont dans l’agriculture et leurs cultures se font en saison. Ils cultivent le mais, le riz, le sorgho et le soja. Les autres membres du groupe veulent assurer les besoins élémentaires de leurs familles.
texts.en:
Assisted by people in carrying out his work (farming), Mr. Katawili was born in 1965. He is married to a farmer, and together they have eighteen children, of whom fifteen have been provided with schooling. 

Katawili is on his fourth WAGES loan and is requesting this loan to supply himself with work tools in order to obtain a good yield. To note, he has been in this domain for 31 years and has a good mastery of the seasons, since he knows what to harvest in this period. His work is all based in RÉGION CENTRALE, and he is quite pleased with it for enabling him to feed the population in general and his family in particular.  

With the profits in hand, he would like to build housing, increase his arable land, and take care of his family. Everyone is in agriculture, and their crops are seasonal. They grow corn, rice, sorghum, and soybeans. The other members of the group want to ensure that their family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: to purchase work tools

loans.name: Lashanda

texts.en: LaShanda is a former event planner for an Atlanta, Georgia, radio station where she coordinated major events such as festivals, concerts and fundraisers. More than 14 years ago, LaShanda and her husband decided to move to Dallas, Texas. She began working as an event coordinator for IBM, but was later laid off. With her extensive knowledge of the event planning industry, LaShanda decided to pursue her own event planning business and has since navigated into wedding planning where the majority of her business resides. Now, four years into her venture, she is excelling. She employs bartenders and waitstaff and, in October 2012, she leased an event center to further expand and market her business. This fall she plans to hire 10 subcontractors and hire one part-time employee. LaShanda’s main goal is to become the premier event planner and hire three part-time employees and 30 subcontractors. Without the loan, LaShanda would have had to continue her business with no money, eventually owing money instead of earning it. The $5,450 loan provides funds to pay rent and utilities, and purchase chairs and equipment for her event studio, allowing her to save the money she would have spent to rent such items. “The loan will give me some relief. If my bills are paid, I will spend less time worrying and more time looking for new business and operating my company,” she says. Check out her website for information on services provided: www.marshallartsgroup.net

loans.use: to pay rent and utilities, and purchase chairs and equipment for her event studio, allowing her to save the money she would have spent to rent such items.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
At JT & Sons Transportation, Juan and his son obtain fresh water and produced water, which is made in seas and lakes where oil and gas are extracted, and transport them to the oil fields in west Texas. 

Juan has 30 years of experience as a small business advisor working for financial organizations, and has worked in transportation as an account manager and dispatcher. With his expertise, Juan was able to steadily manage his business for six consecutive months, including hiring a driver. However, the consistent demand for work has led him to venture for a loan. 

Turning to a friend, Juan learned about Accion Texas Inc., a nonprofit microlender. Juan later applied and was approved for a $5,450 loan to obtain fuel and payroll funds. Without the loan, Juan says the company would not be able to fulfill as many orders.

loans.use: to obtain fuel and payroll funds.

loans.name: Tekoporave Rekavo Group

texts.es:
Tekoporave Rekavo es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, se formo con la unión de vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad. El nombre del grupo significa en busca de una vida mejor en el idioma Guaraní, que es uno de los idiomas del Paraguay. Ellas estan haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza de los cual se pudo notar que 8 mujeres estan con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marlene, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos. Ella cuenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ropas, lencería, etc. lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Tekoporave Rekavo was organized in the city of Caaguazu and was formed by the union of citizens and friends in that city.  The group's name signifies “In Search of a Better Life” in Guarani, one of Paraguay's languages. The members are making an attempt at ending poverty; we should note that 8 of these women earn very loan incomes.

One member is Marlene who during the last survey, demonstrated a level of poverty within Category 1, that is, very low income.  She reports that she is dedicated to selling clothing. We also have the work of the assessors who keep track of the training and testing that, in one manner or another, they require in order to motivate the women to struggle towards overcoming poverty.

Marlene is requesting this loan to buy clothing, under garments, etc., which will help her to develop a concrete business plan, which in turn, will help boost her income.

loans.use: buy clothing and under garments to sell.

loans.name: Lotolagi

texts.en:
Lotolagi is a 57-year-old widowed woman with 10 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Lotolagi has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, and a file for her plantation business. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Lotolagi hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives, and a file

loans.name: Emi

texts.en:
Emi is 46 years old and married with 14 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 1 year now. 

Emi has requested a loan to buy sacks of sugar, flour, baking powder, vanilla, a frying pan, and dripping oil for her business. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital. Emi will use her earnings for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies and cookware for her pancake business

loans.name: Iloa

texts.en:
Iloa is a 41-year-old woman who is married with 5 children. She has a small taxi business. She has being doing this business for many years. 

Iloa needs a loan to buy brand-new tires, engine oil, and car paint, and to pay school fees for her kids. She will use her profits to help her family and her children's education. Iloa joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy tires, engine oil, and car paint for her taxi business, and pay school fees for her kids

loans.name: Inam

texts.en:
Inam is a 45-year-old married woman from a small village near Ramallah City. She is a mother with five sons; all of them are under 18 and still in the school. Inam's husband is a worker with a very low wage. Inam works as a tailor in her home. She works for the local customers in her village. She gets a good income and helps her husband with part of the family expenses. 
Inam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan  will help her to buy a new sewing machine. This will improve her job quality and increase her income. 
Inam appears in the photo in her sewing workshop

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para darle mantenimiento al cultivo de tres manzanas de maíz, ya que luego cultiva maicillo y ajonjolí; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, venenos, insecticidas y pago de mozos.
El efecto del crédito anterior fue positivo, ya que la circunstancias familiares y las condiciones económicas han mejorado, por lo que logro obtener una excelente producción y le ayudo a cancelar sus créditos porque los ingresos fueron favorables, asimismo adquirió una nueva casa.
texts.en:
José finds it necessary to request another loan to be able to support the cultivation of his 3 manzanas of corn. Later, he will grow sorghum and sesame.

This loan will help him to buy the necessary agricultural supplies, like fertilizer, poisons, insecticides, and to pay his workers.

His previous loan was very effective, since his family circumstances and economic conditions have improved. He was able to obtain an excellent crop and this helped him to pay back his loan since his income was favorable. He also bought a new house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, XXXX, insecticides, and to pay his workers.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
